Due to his years of experience, he knows that he will invest the proceeds well and obtain very good results going forward.  His main goal is to be able to give his children the chance to go to college, so that in the future they will have better opportunities and a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and clear his fields of weeds.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with two children and runs a small business selling children’s toys. She started this business 11 years ago using advice form her friends who were in a similar business. 

Today, she's got two business locations and has a desire to develop her business further. Ludmila would like to borrow 4,000 UAH to increase the assortment of her inventory. This business is the only source of income for her family.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of inventory for her toy business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, 33, is married and has three children, two of whom are in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a 13000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Gloria Farley

texts.es:
Gloria tiene una hija de 2 años de edad y debido a que el padre de su hija la abandonó desde que nació su hija, ha tenido grandes dificultades económicas para poder sacar adelante su hogar. Antes Gloria trabajaba haciendo arreglo de uñas, pero como los ingresos no eran suficientes, aprendió la actividad de la elaboración de artesanías y con esto ha podido mejorar sus ingresos y brindarle a su hija lo necesario. La gran dificultad que tiene es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente en su negocio y esto le hace perder ventas, pero ahora que tiene la oportunidad Gloria busca un préstamo para comprar insumos para la elaboración de artesanías y aumentar sus ventas.

Su sueño es poder tener un negocio más organizado donde pueda tener un taller para la elaboración de las artesanías y así generar empleo.
texts.en: Gloria has a 2-year-old daughter and, because the father of her daughter abandoned them when she was born, has had serious economic difficulties in trying to better her home. Before Gloria worked as a manicurist, but as the pay wasn't enough, she learned how to make crafts, which has allowed her to increase her income and provide her daughter with the basic necessities. Her main problem now is that she doesn't have enough capital in her business, which causes her to lose sales. However, now that she has the chance, Gloria is seeking a loan to buy materials to produce her crafts and increase her sales. Her dream is to have a more official business and be able to maintain a workshop where she can manufacture her crafts and also create jobs.

loans.use: to buy materials to produce her crafts and increase her sales.

loans.name: Dúo Ruth De Villa Nueva Group

texts.es:
DUO RUTH DE VILLA NUEA.
ESTA FORMADO POR LA SEÑORA MARIA HILDA ES CASADA TIENE 4 HIJOS TIENES 48 AÑOS  SU NEGOCIO ES  VENTA DE GALLINA SU SUEÑO ES LLEGAR  ATENER SU PROPIA CARNICERIA DE VENTAS DE CARNE POLLO LO QUE MAS LE HA GUSTADO DE FAPE SON LOS INTERESES Y LA FORMA DE PAGO Y LE PIDE A FAPE LA PUEDA SEGUIR APOYADO CON SU CREDITO. YA QUE ES UNA FORMA DE SUPERARSE EN SU NEGOCIO.ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE MAS MERCADERIA EN CARNE DE POLLO PARA LA VENTA.
texts.en: The "Ruth de Villa Nueva" pair includes Mrs. Maria Hilda, a married women of 48 with four children. Her business is in selling hens and her dream is to be able to establish her own butcher shop for poultry. What she has most appreciated about FAPE [Kiva field partner] are the interest rates and the payment options, and so she is seeking to be able to go on receiving loans with FAPE. As one way of improving her business, she is requesting this loan to buy more poultry for sale.

loans.use: to buy more poultry for sale.

loans.name: Telesfora

texts.en:
Telesfora is 61 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Telesfora is borrowing 22000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and additional livestock to raise.

Telesfora has been raising livestock for 24 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchse feed and additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Armelita

texts.en:
Armelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a butcher shop in the Philippines.

Armelita requested a 20000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more meat to sell in her food stall. Armelita has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Armelita would like to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more RTW's (Ready To Wear) clothes to resell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 27 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Nancy is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Nancy has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from abaca weaving. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Tessie works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming bananas and clothing sales. Tessie is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her business.

Tessie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell for her charcoal retail business.

loans.name: Ingenio Vecinal Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “INGENIO VECINAL”  iniciará el decimo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Yamila es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, venta de cosméticos, venta de chicharrones, promotora de ventas, venta de material escolar, serigrafía.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Yamila es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de cosméticos; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre y sus amigas que realizaban esta actividad, posteriormente ella inicio su propio emprendimiento.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de productos cosméticos) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras en la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará a sus amigas y familiares. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta conocer y compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The “INGENIO VECINAL” communal bank will begin its eighteenth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Cascada. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a board of directors of which Yamila is the secretary. The businesses which the members of the communal bank run are varied and include: a local shop, selling cosmetics, selling pork cracklings, promoting sales, selling school materials and silk screen printing. 

The loan which they will receive will benefit the group of small businesswomen to which Yamila belongs. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for four years, joining on invitation by a promoter of the institution who visited her at her home. She currently has a business selling cosmetics; she says that she learnt this business from her mother and her friends who had this kind of business, and later decided to start up on her own. 

The loan which she will now receive is to increase her capital (buying cosmetic products) which she will acquire from distributors in the city of El Alto and which she will later sell to her friends and relatives. This way of working allows her to generate resources in order to support her family as best she can.  

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes to get to know her fellow members and share things with them.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El señor David  es casado, tiene tres hijos, vive en la casa propia, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Villa Cooperativa de la ciudad de El Alto.

David, trabaja con su padre como artesano en la fabricación de ollas de aluminio, actividad que le permite percibir sus ingresos para mantener a su familia 

El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material (aluminio por hojas, agarraderas y pegamento especial) para la elaboración de más ollas, así incrementar sus ingresos ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.

El sueño del señor David es el de incrementar su capital de trabajo, y trabajar independientemente en su negocio.

David tiene cinco créditos con IMPRO y con KIVA es la primera vez.
texts.en:
David is married and has 3 children.  He lives in his own home, located in the Villa Cooperativa neighborhood in the city of El Alto.

David works with his father as a craftsman making aluminum pots.  This work allows him to earn income to support his family.

David needs a loan to buy supplies (sheets of aluminum, handles and special glue) to make more pots.  This way he can increase his income, because he needs to cover the expenses for his family's food, education and basic services.

David's dream is to increase his working capital and work independently in his business.  He has taken 5 loans with IMPRO, but this is his first Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy sheets of aluminum, handles and special glue for his business making pots

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en: Belinda is 52 years old and married with 3 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Belinda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Belinda requested a 29,500 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell. Belinda has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Belinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en: Sheryl is 24 years old and is married to Reden, a father who helps her to meet their needs. Sheryl is engaged in a direct-selling business. She has been doing this for two years and earns about 1,500 PHP a month. Sheryl wants to have more products to sell. For this reason, Sheryl is asking for a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to buy shampoo, powder and soap to sell in the local community. She believes that through her loan, she will be able to obtain the products that she wants to sell.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, powder and soap to sell in the local community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 60 years old and married, with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for four years, and she sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, sugar, soap, etc. 

In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes, de 45 años es una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de Miguel, su esposo desde hace 15 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos a los que cuidan en casa de sus suegros desde hace 12 años.  En estos momentos se encuentra atravesando una crisis económica, pues alquiló un terreno en donde sembró alfalfa, los dueños del terreno vendieron todo el pasto verde. Causando que ella perdiera todo lo invertido pero aún así no se decae. Pues aprendió a observar una oportunidad dentro de este problema. Ahora es un poco más cuidadosa, pues sembrará alfalfa en su propio terreno agrícola, como es poco, piensa comprar a terceras personas el pasto ya crecido. Ya que su principal ingreso económico se centra en la comercialización de fardos de alfalfa, las cuales diariamente manada a la capital del país, un promedio de 200 fardos. “Mi capital de trabajo se mueve a diario”, menciona Lourdes, quien se siente independiente y capaz de hacer crecer su negocio. Ahora desea comprar su propio terreno agrícola, para ello comenzó a ahorrar dinero, pues ya no confía en alquilar terreno a terceras personas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “sicaya 2000” y este es el crédito número 12 con MFP, se siente feliz pues en este tiempo logró obtener muchas ganancias, todo gracias al apoyo económico que le brindan. Por ello promete cumplir con el pago de las cuotas. Además gusta de trabajar en su asociación, donde los integrantes son personas solidarias y trabajadoras.
Lourdes, invertirá el dinero en la compra de varios sembríos de alfalfa para la venta.
texts.en:
Lourdes, 45, is a cheerful woman. She lives with Miguel, her husband of 15 years.  They have two children, whom they have been taking care of in the home of their in-laws for 12 years.  

At this time she is going through a financial crisis, as she rented a piece of land where she planted alfalfa, but the owners of the land sold all the green grass, causing her to lose her entire investment. But even so, she hasn't let it get her down, as she learned to see an opportunity within this problem. 

Now she is a little more careful, as she will plant alfalfa on her own farmland.  As she has little, she intends to buy already-grown grass from third parties. Her main source of income is selling bales of alfalfa, that she sends daily to the country's capital; an average of 200 bales. "My working capital moves daily" says Lourdes, who she feels independent, and capable of making her business grow.

Now she wishes to buy her own farmland, so she began to save money, as she no longer relies on renting land from third parties. 

She belongs to the “Sicaya 2000” communal bank, and this is her 12th loan with MFP. She feels happy, as in this time she has managed to earn considerable profits, all thanks to the financial assistance that they provide her. Therefore she promises to make her installment payments. In addition, she likes to work in her group, where the members are supportive and hard-working people. 

Lourdes will use the money to buy several sown fields of alfalfa, in order to sell the alfalfa.

loans.use: To buy land planted with alfalfa.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is a hardworking woman who has had a fishing business for the past eighteen years. She also makes money raising pigs.

Adela has been successful through both her own efforts and with the help of NWTF loans. She is now applying for a 15,000 PHP loan for maintenance on her fishing boat. Her ambition is to keep growing her business.

loans.use: do maintenance on her fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee fields.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 36 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family.

For the past seven years Analiza has run her sari-sari, or general store. She also earns money specifically selling rice.

Analiza has borrowed and paid off three loans from NWTF before this loan request. She is now applying for a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase more stock for her sari-sari. Her ambition is to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her sari-sari.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is 44 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Criselda is borrowing 10000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Criselda has been fattening pigs for nine years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 32,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her bakery business.

Jelly has been in this business for 10 years.  She also earns more income from raising pigs.

Jelly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jonabel

texts.en:
Jonabel works hard to support her family. Jonabel is married, and she has a fishing business in the Philippines.  Jonabel has been in this business for 10 years now.

Jonabel has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

In the future, Jonabel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional materials to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.es:
Emanuel, es casado y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar , viven en casa de sus tíos ocupando dos habitaciones , la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada por más de ocho horas al día ya que debe cubrir los gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora ya que actualmente estudia administración de empresas en la universidad ya que le será de mucha ayuda en sus estudios.
El sueño de Emanuel, es mejorar sus ingresos y poder independizarse para dar más comodidad a su familia.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Emanuel is married, and has two school-aged children. They live with their aunt and uncle, occupying two rooms. The house is located in the Alto San Pedro area of the city of La Paz.  

Currently he works as an employee at a private company for more than eight hours a day, as he must cover his family's expenses for education, food and payment of basic services.

He needs the loan to buy a computer, as currently he is studying business administration at the university and it will be a great help to him in his studies. 

Emanuel's dream is to improve his income and be independent, so that he can give more comfort to his family. 

This is the first time he has applied for a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a computer to help with his studies in business administration at a university in the city of La Paz.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is seventy years old and married with three grown children. She works hard to help support her family.

Anselma has sold school supplies for the past fifteen years. She also makes money by raising livestock.

Anselma has borrowed and paid off sixteen loans from NWTF. She is now applying for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy more supplies to sell. Her ambition is to keep her business growing.

loans.use: to buy more school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline, 49, is married and has four children, two of whom are in school.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a 22000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evangeline has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising chickens. Gina is borrowing 23000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Pech is 38 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in garment factory for more than a year, earning about $4 daily. Her husband (who joins her in the picture) is a rice farmer who earns about $2 each day. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about $3 per day. 

To improve her family’s finances, Pech is requesting a loan of $1,300 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run as a taxi service. This purchase will help her husband generate additional income to financially support the family. 

In the future, she would like to build a new house and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run the taxi service.

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
Joselito is 43 years old and single. For the past five years she has sold charcoal for a living.

Joselito is applying for a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. Her ambition is to keep her business growing.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Lira

texts.en:
Lira is 35 years old and married, with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lira is borrowing PHP 18 000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Lira has been raising pigs for 10 years, and she also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is married, with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lorna is 56 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lorna has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Lorna has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima of San Miguel, Bohol, has had a rice farming business for 30 years now. She is 57 years old, with one adult son. She works hard on her farm so she can provide for her family's basic needs like food. 

She would like for her farming business to be successful. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and a sprayer. These are important so her crops will be resistant to rice diseases. She hopes that in the future, she can continue to sustain her business and save for old age.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and a sprayer.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie, 38, is married with one child, who is in school. Margie works very hard to provide for them.

Margie runs a business selling nipa (a woven palm mat used for house construction and repair) in the Philippines and requested a 13000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of nipa to sell. Margie has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Margie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of nipa (for house construction and repair) to sell.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 55 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to help provide for them.

For the past 22 years Merlita has run a sari-sari, or general store. She sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, shampoo, cooking oil, noodles and canned goods.

Merlita is applying for a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional goods to stock her store. Her ambition is to keep her business growing.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to stock her store.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús, es viudo y tiene cinco hijos de los cuales todos  ya son independientes, vive en casa propia ocupando tres habitaciones con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de ganado camélido en diferentes ferias, y también percibe ingresos leyendo la suerte en coca y como curandero con plantas naturales. Ya que debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar más ganado (comprará tres llamas) para después de hacerlo engorar ponerlos a la venta  ya que desea mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Jesús es construir su casa para poder acoger a sus hijos.
Es la sexta vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Jesús is a widower and has five children, all of whom are now independent. He lives in his own house, occupying three rooms with brick walls and earth floor. The house is located in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz.

Currently, he sells llamas in various markets, and also earns income reading fortunes using coca leaves, and as a healer with natural plants. This is because he must cover his expenses for food and payment of basic services. 

He needs the loan to buy more livestock (he will buy three llamas), in order to put them up for sale after fattening them, as he wishes to improve his income and quality of life. 

Jesús' dream is to finish building his house, so that he can take in his children. 

This is the sixth time that he has worked with IMPRO, and the second time with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase three  llamas to raise and for eventual resale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nancy works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Nancy is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish for her fish vending business.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business selling coconut wine in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional gallon of coconut wine for her business.

Pacita has been in this business for 10 years. Pacita also earns other income from raising chickens and fish vending.

Pacita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to finish her two children in college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine.

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es:
Lupe, es casada y tiene seis hijos, de los cuales  dos están en etapa escolar y cuatro ya son independientes, viven en casa propia ocupando tres habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente se dedica a la administración de alquileres de habitaciones en su casa y también cuenta con el sueldo de su esposo ya que ambos cubren los gastos alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para realizar la obra fina de tres habitaciones, ya que desea ponerlas en alquiler  y  tener más ingresos. Para esto, necesita comprar estuco, pinturas, enchufes y cables.
El sueño de Lupe, es cubrir los gastos universitarios de sus dos hijos hasta que sean profesionales.
Es la quinta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Lupe is married, and has six children; of whom two are school-aged, and four are already independent. They live in their own home, occupying three rooms. The house is located in the Sopocachi area of the city of La Paz.

Presently, she rents out rooms in her home, and also has her husband's salary, as they share the family's expenses for food, education, and payment of basic services. 

She needs the loan to the finishing work on three rooms, as she wishes to rent them out and have more income. For this, she needs to buy stucco, paint, electrical outlets and wiring.

Lupe's dream is to cover university expenses for her two children, so that they can be professionals. 

This is the fifth time she is applying for a loan with IMPRO, and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy stucco, paint, electrical outlets and wiring, so that she can finish three rooms in her home and rent them out.

loans.name: Sok Ny

texts.en:
Sok Ny, 41, is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Two of her children are employed at a garment factory. They earn about $6 each day. 

Sok Ny has been growing rice and water convolvulus (a leafy vegetable) to sell for more than two years, earning approximately $2 daily.

She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a pumping machine to use for farming. This purchase will make it easy for her to cultivate her crops. 

In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and help her youngest child earn a higher education. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a pumping machine to use for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothes to resell.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Bautista Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO AMANECER BAUTISTA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lourdes es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de pulpería, venta de verduras, venta de comida, elaboración de prendas, venta de repuestos, macramé de mantas, venta de chompas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lourdes es integrante, ella indica que el tercer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de repuestos de movilidad; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió hace años, con la compra de unos cuantos repuestos, lo que fue un capital básico, posteriormente con esfuerzos y mucho trabajo amplio su mercadería.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de repuestos de movilidad) que adquirirá de las importadoras y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella está casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Amanecer Bautista communal bank will begin its new loan cycle with Pro Mujer, which is part of the Los Andes Regional Office. The group is comprised of eight members and is managed by a director's board, of which Lourdes is the president. The businesses of the group's members are varied. Among them are a local store, vegetable sales, food sales, clothing production, spare parts sales, macrame blanket production, and sweater production.

This loan taken out will benefit Lourdes's small businesses. She says that this is her third cycle with Pro Mujer. She was admitted by invitation from a promoter of the group who came to her house to visit her. Currently, she has a business that sells spare car parts. She says that she launched the business years ago with the purchase of some parts, which was her initial capital. Then she worked hard and put a lot of effort into increasing her merchandise.

The loan she will take out is to increase her capital (to buy spare car parts), which she will get from importers. She will then sell it in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate income to support her family as much as possible. She is married and has six children.

When asked about what she likes most about Pro Mujer, Lourdes responded that she likes the health training and the loans.

loans.use: to buy spare car parts

loans.name: Grover

texts.es:
Grover, es casado y tiene un hijo que esta en etapa escolar, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona los andes de la ciudad de La Paz.

Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como profesor por más de ocho horas al día en dos Instituciones educativas y con lo que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.

El crédito lo requiere para la compra de cemento, estuco y ladrillos para la refacción de su vivienda ya que sus paredes se encuentran muy deterioradas; también realizará la legalización de los documentos del mismo, ya que desea tener más seguridad.

El sueño de Grover es mejorar sus ingresos ya que desea construir más habitaciones y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Grover is married, and has a school-aged son. He lives in his parents' home, occupying two rooms. The house is located in the Los Andes area of the city of La Paz. 

Currently he earns income, as he works as a teacher for more than eight hours a day in two schools. With what he earns he must cover his family's expenses for food, education, and payment of basic services. 

He needs the loan in order to buy cement, stucco and bricks for repairing his house, as the walls are in very poor condition. He will also legalize the title  documents for his home, as he wishes to have more security. 

Grover's dream is to improve his income, as he wishes to build more rooms and improve his quality of life. 

It is the second time he has worked with IMPRO, and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy cement, stucco, and bricks for repairing the walls of the rooms in his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in making barbeque.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a responsible mother who is engaged in the retailing business. She has been doing this for three years. She is now 39 years old and happily married to Samuel. The couple is thankful because they had been blessed with three children. 

Jocelyn would like to offer more products, so she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, assorted breads, candies and condiments to sell in her store. 

Jocelyn would like to provide a good education to her children, as the only legacy that she will pass to them.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, assorted breads, candies, and condiments to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Majeedan

texts.en:
Majeedan, 38, has operated a business trading clothes for many years. She has three children and is in charge of providing them with the basic necessities of life.

She works hard to diversify her livelihood as she understands that she need not solely depend on the income earned by her husband. Her husband works in a grocery store and earns a low income to support his family. 

Majeedan's collection is much appreciated by her customers, and her business has improved gradually. She needed to expand her business, so she contacted Kashf Foundation for the first time. She requested a loan of 15000 PKR to buy a variety of cloth in different colors to increase sales. She is very excited about this new loan and wants to spend a portion of the profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cloth in different colors to increase sales.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia, 37, is from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with six children ages 1 to 14. 

Bonifacia is engaged in a food vending business. She usually likes to sell home-cooked snacks like deep-fried bananas and pancakes. Her business started two years ago. 

She is asking for a 10000 PHP loan to buy flour, bananas and cooking oil. She hopes that through this loan, she will have a better income with an increase in her production. The profit will help her pay her children's school fees as well as buy food for them.

loans.use: to buy flour, bananas and cooking oil.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a 36-year-old farmer from Nkubu in Kenya. She lives with her husband and two children, one of whom attends school. Stella has been farming for the past 10 years, producing fruits, vegetables and cereals and keeping poultry, which she sells locally.

Stella is requesting a loan of 52,500 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She hopes to open a cereal shop, which will help her educate her children and improve her living standards. Stella's main challenges are poor rainfall and lack of ready market for her produce. She says that Juhudi Kilimo is doing a good job for small scale farmers.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, aged 42, is a farmer in Nkubu. She lives with her husband and their four children, only one of whom attends school. Jane has been in farming for fifteen years, producing horticulture products and selling them at a local market. She also sells milk as an additional source of income.

Jane is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to build a greenhouse to help improve her production, which will help her pay her children’s school fees. She also intends to buy more acres of land to expand her production. Jane's main challenges are crop pests and diseases, lack of capital and a poor market. She likes Juhudi Kilimo for its faster processing of loans.

loans.use: To buy materials for constructing a greenhouse

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, aged 41, is a farmer in the Nkubu area of Kenya,  where she lives with her two children who both attend school. She has been farming for 20 years, producing cereals which she sells at the local market. Jane also runs a retail shop as an additional source of income.

Jane is requesting a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a chuff cutter and materials for constructing  a zero grazing unit to enhance her milk production from her two cows. Jane hopes to buy three more dairy cows in the future to boost her income and thus help her pay her children’s school fees. Jane's main challenges are crop pests and diseases, animal diseases and a poor market. She likes Juhudi Kilimo because of their efficiency in processing loans.

loans.use: To buy a chuff cutter and materials for building a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en: Ms Fozia had the urge to be a businesswoman and she knew the art of being a beautician. She has now been a beautician for 2 years and has a beauty parlor. She has now taught her daughter about this art and together they take care of the beauty parlor. Fozia's success also inspires other women to own their own business. She currently requires 20,000 PKR to buy a new make-up kit, hair colors and other products for the smooth running of her business and to fight the wave of inflation.

loans.use: To buy a new make-up kit, hair colors and other products for her salon

loans.name: Saddiqa

texts.en: Ms. Saddiqan is a very hardworking woman and supports her family. Saddiqan lives in Faisalabad. Both husband and wife support each other. They started a business 20 years ago. Now they own two separate machines in the delicate work of label making, which is used by garment manufacturers and boutiques. The work is very delicate as the thread used (mirror thread) is very costly and sensitive. She requested a loan of Rs. 10,000 to buy the raw material used in the label making.

loans.use: to buy the raw material used in label making

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Pamba Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma, who is in her mid 30s, is married and has three boys; two are in school and the other is still young. Mwajuma is employed but also earns a living by running three businesses: a beauty salon and cosmetics sales since 2006 and a genge-duka (grocery stall) selling fruits, vegetables and charcoal since 1996.  She employs workers to run her two businesses but sells cosmetics herself to specific customers. Her businesses operate from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and are able to give her a good profit.

This will be Mwajuma's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania and she wants to use it to increase her stock of cosmetics to resell. Mwajuma's dream is to one day be able to expand all her businesses. She will share this loan with her loan group "Pamba" which consists of 10 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of cosmetics to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more coconut to resell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
This is Editha. She previously accessed a 38,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Editha dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and to pay for the maintenance of their van. Her earnings were a big help for her children's education and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

Elizabeth would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their van. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain the family's daily needs and the children's educational expenses. Elizabeth looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elizabeth hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their van.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. Harriet sells charcoal from home. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last three years. She works seven days a week. 

Harriet has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to start selling on a wholesale basis so as to serve more customers and to build her own house. She lives in a rented house. Her family has access to electricity but doesn’t have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothes to resell

loans.name: Khana Naira Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KHANA NAIRA”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Dora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: taller de carpintería, servicios de filmación, confección de chamarras, elaboración de mantas, venta de refrescos, venta de detergentes, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Dora es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicios de filmación; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió hace años, conjuntamente su esposo que ya trabajaba en este rubro, posteriormente ella también participó y ampliaron el negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para mejoramiento de equipo (compra de filmadora) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de servicio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella está casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Khana Naira" will begin its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer, which, as part of the Los Andes regional hub, is made up of eight members. It is directed by a board of directors, of which Dora is the president. The businesses that the communal bank supports are varied; among them are a carpentry workshop, filming services, jacket-making, blanket-making, refreshment sales, detergent sales, and a neighborhood store.

The loan they will take out will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs such as Dora. She says that two years ago, she joined Pro Mujer on the invitation of one of the institution's promoters who had come to her house to visit her. Currently, she has a filming services business. She says that she launched this business years ago with her husband, who was already working in the field. After that, she participated, too, and they expanded the business.

The loan that she will now take out is to upgrade equipment by purchasing a movie camera that she will acquire from the distributor and later set up in their workspace. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes saving money.

loans.use: to buy a movie camera

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es:
John aprendió la actividad de la agricultura desde que estaba muy pequeño gracias a que su padre se dedicaba a esto y se la enseñó para trabajar a su lado. Ahora que tiene una experiencia de unos 20 años realizando esta actividad puede tener productos de muy buena calidad y esto le permite mejorar los ingresos para su hogar donde convive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 9 y 13 años de edad. La gran dificultad que siempre ha padecido es el invierno que frecuentemente daña sus cultivos, y el no contar con un capital suficiente para recuperarlos; es por esto que ahora que tiene la oportunidad busca un préstamo para comprar abonos, riegos y semillas para sacar adelante su cultivo y preservarlo del fuerte invierno.

Su sueño es llegar a tener un gran terreno cultivado y mejorar los ingresos para su familia y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa y sus 2 hijos.
texts.en:
John learned the agriculture business starting when he was very small, thanks to that his father worked in it and taught him to work at his side.  Now that he has 20 years of experience working in this business he can have high quality products and this allows him to improve his income for his home, where he lives with his wife and 2 children, 9 and 13 years old.  The biggest challenge that he has always faced is the winter that frequently harms his crops, and he doesn't have enough capital to recover them.  It is because of this that now that he has the opportunity,  he is looking for a loan to buy fertilizers, irrigation and seeds to get his crop ahead and maintain it during the harsh winter.

His dream is to have a large farm and improve his income for his family and offer his wife and 2 children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, irrigation and seeds to get his crop ahead and maintain it in the harsh winter.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, age 50, is a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines.  She is married to Gilberto, a jeepney operator, and is a mother to her child.  She and her husband manage their household while operating the business.  At this time she is continually working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Erlinda operates a van rental business.  They have 1 van that they offer to be rented for transportation service or for people who need a van for out-of-town service.  They provide their services within the city and nearby provinces.  Aside from this, she also sells processed meats for additional income.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP.  She will be utilizing the loan for spare parts and maintenance of her van.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  Erlinda hopes to grow her business and dreams to be able to give her child a good, high-quality education through all her hard work on her business.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their van.

loans.name: Las Pagadoras De Villa Ingenio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS PAGADORAS DE VILLA INGENIO”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de verduras, tejido de mantas, venta de bañadores y baldes, venta de pipocas de maíz, venta de ropa coreana, costura de faldas, fundición de aluminio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alicia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de fundición de aluminio donde elaboran aros; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió al ayudar a sus padres, ya que los mismos trabajan en esta área.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para ampliación de capital (compra de aluminio) que adquirirá de las tiendas que venden chatarra y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las tiendas a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella está casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el trabajo en grupo.
texts.en:
The group “LAS PAGADORAS DE VILLA INGENIO” will begin their first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Focus Center of Los Andes, it's formed by six members and lead by board of directors where Alicia is the president.  The businesses that the members have are varied such as: vegetable sales, blanket knitting, bath items sales, popcorn sales, Korean clothing sales, skirt tailoring and aluminum melting. 

The loan requested will benefit the micro-businesses of the group Alicia is part of, she indicates that this is the first time she came to Pro 
Mujer, she joined after being invited by one of the institution promoters that went to see her at home.  Currently she has a business where she melts aluminum and where they make rings; she started this business to help her parents, who also work on this activity.

This new loan will be used to increase working capital and buy aluminum  that she will buy from places that sell scrap metal and later on she will will sell to stores by the order.  This system allows her to generate income to support her family, she is married with two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says working with a group.

loans.use: to buy aluminum

loans.name: Dúo Grande Solo Dios Group

texts.es:
Dúo Grande solo Dios.
Este Dúo está conformado por la señora Susana originaria de Tecpán,   tiene 7 hijos  menores de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano a veces le hacen pedidos de tejidos como servilletas típicas pero ella no se compromete a elaborarlos ya que no cuenta con suficiente Capital para trabajar, ella está solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de tejidos típicos.
texts.en: This duo is formed by Hugo and Susana, Susana is from Tecpan who has seven young children and works on hand crafted fabrics that are sometimes custom ordered such as cloth napkins, she doesn't always commit to making them as she doesn't have enough working capital, she requests a loan to buy raw materials to make typical hand-crafted fabrics.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make typical hand-crafted fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dried fish to resell.

loans.name: Amigas De Huancane Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIGAS DE HUANCANE”  iniciará el decimo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nicolasa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de leche y queso, venta de charque en las fronteras del país, venta de pescado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nicolasa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de queso y leche; cuenta que gran parte de la personas de su comunidad viven de este oficio, es por ello que emprendió esta iniciativa.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado) que adquirirá de las comunidades de alrededor y posteriormente lo criará en su estancia. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el trabajo que se realiza.
texts.en:
The “AMIGAS DE HUANCANE” group will begin their 18th cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Focus Center of Copacabana, it's formed by 8 members and lead by a board of directors where Nicolasa is the president.  The businesses of the community group members are varied, such as: milk and cheese sales, sales of jerky by the country's borders, fish sales.

The loan requested will benefit the micro-entrepreneurs' group where Nicolasa is a member, she indicates that this is the first time she came to Pro Mujer, she joined after being invited by one of the institution promoters that went to see her at home.  She currently sells cheese and milk, she indicates that many of the people in her community work on the same business and that's the reason why she started to sell dairy.

The loan requested is to increase working capital to buy cows that she will get from the surrounding communities and she will later raise at her ranch.  This form of work will allow her to generate income to support her family, she is married with two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the work they do.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es: Zoila es originaria de San Martin Jilotepeque tiene 46 años de edad ella se dedica a la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos desde hace 10 años, de está fuente esque ella obtiene los ingresos necesarios para ayudar a su familia ya que ella es viuda y a ella le a tocado dedicarse al cuido de sus 2 hijos que tiene a su responsabilidad, ella elabora servilletas, bufandas, tapetes, etc. ella está solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos.
texts.en: Zoila is orginally from San Martin Jilotepeque, she is 46 and makes typical hand crafted fabrics, she started making them 10 years ago, this is her source of income to help her family, she is a widow and takes care of her two children that are depend on her, she makes cloth napkins, scarfs, mats, etc.  She requests this credit to buy raw materials to make typical hand-crafted fabrics.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make typical hand-crafted fabrics.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn, a mother of two who works as a tailor. She previously accessed a 15,000 Phillipine pesos (PHP) loan that she used to purchase raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her family's personal, household and business expenses. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan so that she can buy additional supplies of raw materials. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial help with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jocelyn dreams of giving her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for materials like fabric and thread that she for her business.

loans.name: Grupo Joyitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GRUPO JOYITAS”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Andrea es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ganado ovino, tienda de barrio, venta de carne, venta de ropa, venta de queso, venta de chuño, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Andrea es integrante, ella indica que es la primer año que participa Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que quiso formar un grupo. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de ropa; cuenta que hace años inicio este negocio con por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que adquirirá de la Ciudad de La paz y posteriormente lo venderá en las ferias comunales. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene ocho hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The group “GRUPO JOYITAS” will begin their 2nd cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Focus Center of Patacamaya, it's formed by 10 members and lead by a board of directors where Andrea is the president.  The businesses that the members of the community association work on are varied, such as: sheep sales, convenience store, meat sales, clothing sales, cheese sales, chuño (freeze-dried potato) sales, vegetable sales.

The loan will benefit the micro-entrepreneurs' group that Andrea is part of, this is the first year she participates with Pro Mujer, she joined through an invitation from a friend that wanted to form a group. She currently has a clothing sales business, she started many years ago on her own.  The loan requested is to increase working capital and buy clothes that she will get at the city of La Paz and will later on sell at the community fairs.  This system allows her to generate income to support her family as much as she can, she is married and has 8 children. 

When asked what she likes of Pro Mujer, she indicates the training sessions related to money and health.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en: Hoeurn is 35 years old.  She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.  She has been running the business of purchasing rice to resell for more than ten years, earning approximately $7 per day.  Her husband, who is joining her in the picture, is a construction worker who earns about $5 per day.  In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Hoeurn is requesting a loan of $800 to raise capital in her business.  This will allow her to purchase more rice to sell.  By doing so, she would earn more profit to support the family.  In the future, she would like to run an additional business and send her children to earn a bachelor’s degree.  Moreover, she plans to fix some part of her house to make it more convenient.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of canned goods, and snacks.

loans.name: Yunita

texts.en: Yunita comes from Sorong, the easternmost region of Indonesia, specifically in West Papua. Because in Papua island areas there are many harbor boats, Yunita want to be a native daughter who can work in and build her own country. Yunita is currently studying at the Academy of Maritime science Nusantara. She is studying in the Management Commerce and Harbor Administration program. Her parent works as a fisherman whose income depends on the weather. Bad weather and high winds result in not catching fish because the waves are too big. Yunita wants to help ease the burden on her parents with a loan from Kiva so Yunita is joining the loan program. Yunita wants to finish school and get a job quickly at a port in her own country. Yunita thanks Kiva lenders because these loans can help with her studies for three years.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is aged 33. She is married and has five children, aged between five months and 16 years. She sells skirts and has spent six years in the business. 

She wants this loan to buy more skirts to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more skirts to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal TODOS UNIDOS, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de repuestos para automoviles, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cuenta con un local alquilado donde vende toda su mercadería como llantas, timones, siliconas, retrovisores entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de retrovisores de autos para su negocio.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Todos Unidos ("All United") Communal Bank. She continues with her business of selling spare parts for automobiles. She has been in this business for years and it is going well thanks to the dedication she puts into her work every day. She has a rented location where she sells all of her merchandise, such as tires, steering wheels, silicon products, and rear-view mirrors, among others. She is a responsible and dedicated person and this business is how she provides for her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy automobile rear-view mirrors for her business.

She feels grateful for the loan and promises to comply with her established repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy automobile rear-view mirrors for her business

loans.name: Saraem

texts.en:
Saraem is 52 years old. She is widowed and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her children are employed. They are salespeople who earn about $6 daily. In order to improve her family finances, Saraem is requesting a loan of $800. She plans to purchase a motorbike for her son to run the taxi service when he’s free from his work. By doing so, he would generate extra income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to run an additional business and rebuild her house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her son to run a taxi service.

loans.name: 040128-Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Nga is 33 years old and married with two children. Nga operates a business selling fish and is requesting a loan to purchase netting to fish. Nga has been involved in this business for eight years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is lack of capital.
Nga is the leader of an eight-member group, the 040128-Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường  solidarity group. 
Nga supports her two dependents through her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Nga joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Nga has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Nga hopes to maintain a successful business and to make enough money to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase netting to fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to resell.

loans.name: 040136-Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Dung is 21 years old, is married and has two children. Dung operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase netting for fishing. Dung has been involved in this business for four years. The main hardship that Dung faces in her business is the lack of capital.

She is the leader of a four-member group, the 040136-Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường  solidarity group. 
Nga supports her two dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Dung has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Dung hopes to maintain a successful business, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business and to make enough money to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase netting for fishing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pagnes sets (West African fabrics) in bulk.

loans.name: Servando

texts.en:
This is Servando. He is 52 and a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite Philippines. He is married to Corazon, who is a store owner and a mother. At this time, Servando is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Servando oversees operations of their jeepney transportation business. They have one Jeep that carries up to sixteen passengers to their destinations within the community. Their regular customers are from the local community. He earns income from the boundary (daily quota) their driver remits everyday. He earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in boundary every day.

To help him continue business operations, he is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan for the maintenance of his jeepney unit. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Servando dreams of giving his family a good future. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from study of the Word of God. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of his jeepney vehicle

loans.name: Nocha

texts.en: Nocha is a student of the Academy of Maritime Nusantara. Ship engineering is the program that he studies. From an early age, he wanted to become a technician on an Indonesian Navy warship. His parents are very supportive of Nocha's education so that his life will be better in the future. Nocha’s father works as a private employee with sufficient income for their daily needs. Nocha is the second child of three sisters and two brothers who are still in school. His parents are struggling to find additional funds to finance Nocha’s study. His parents want their children to obtain a good life. Seeing his parents' persistence, Nocha is eager to help. Nocha is asking for a student loan from Kiva to ease his parents' burden and finish his education. Nocha thanks the lenders who help him to finance his studies..

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is still repaying his Kiva loan which he received for his daughter’s tuition for a previous semester. 
Now he is asking for a concurrent loan of 200.000 AMD to pay tuition for the current semester.

loans.use: to pay tuition fee for his daughter for the current semester.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine, 29, is married to a businessman. She sells clothes and has spent two years in the business. She wants this loan to buy more shirts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings for a better future.

loans.use: to buy more shirts to sell.

loans.name: Bophavy

texts.en: Bophavy is 48 years old. She is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than 10 years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband is a taxi driver who earns about $5 each day. One of her children is an assistant truck driver. He earns about $3 per day. In order to stabilize her family’s living conditions, Bophavy is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more groceries to sell. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree. In addition, she plans to rebuild her house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Isabelle

texts.en:
Isabelle is 39 years old. She is married and has two children aged 7 months and 4 years. She sells fabrics and has spent eight years in the business. 
She wants this loan to buy more fabrics to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more money for savings for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Hameedan

texts.en:
Ms Hameedan is a vigorous 52-year-old lady who has been running a “General store” with her husband for seven years. The man shown in the photo is Hameedan’s husband. She has three children and all of them attend school. Her husband also assists her by buying goods from the market. He is very supportive of her, which is why she is able to give proper time to the store. He feels proud of his wife.  

She needs a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy more stock of rice and packs of oil because these items are demanded time after time at her store. This will help her to expand her business. They are hopeful of earning more profits and wish to use part of the profits to better their children and increase their business capital.

loans.use: To buy the stock of rice and packs of oil

loans.name: 0201012 Thôn 3 - Hoằng Đông Group

texts.en:
Lan works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase pigs to raise.

Lan is 31 years old and she is married with three children. Lan supports her three dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She is the leader of a five-member group, the 0201012 Thôn 3 - Hoằng Đông solidarity group. 

In 2010, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lan has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lan has been involved in her agricultural business for 8 years. The main hardship that Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Lan hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to raise.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El socio José Luis pertenece al banco comunal “Todos Unidos” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.  

El socio José Luis continua con su negocio de venta de autopartes y accesorios para automoviles ,el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,el socio viaja cada cierto tiempo a la ciudad de Lima para comprar su mercaderia para luego venderlo a sus clientes el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el credito para la compra de bujias y llantas para su negocio.
 
El socio José Luis agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
José Luis belongs to the communal bank "Todos Unidos" of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.

José Luis is continuing with his auto parts and accessories sales business. He has had this business for years and it is going well thanks to the effort he puts into it each day. He regularly travels to the city of Lima to buy his merchandise to later resell to his customers. He is a responsible and hardworking person which is how he gets his family ahead. 

He is asking for a loan to purchase spark plugs and tire for his business. José Luis appreciates the support he has been offered and he is committed to making his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase spark plugs and tires for his business.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.fr: Patricia est une jeune femme âgée de 31 ans qui vit dans un quartier de la capiltale. Mère de la famille, elle tient un sallon de coiffure dans un coin de la place. Grâce à la maîtrise de son actvité, elle  s'est faite une clientèle grandissante qu'elle souhaiterait continuer de satisfaire. Pour cela elle sollicite un prêt qui lui permettrait d'acheter: des mèches, des greffes, des défrisants et tout autre complément pour agrandir son stock. Les bénéfices obtenus de cette activité grâce à ce financement lui permettront d'agrandir son activité, d'embaucher une personne qui l'aiderait pour son activité, de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et surtout assurer la scolarisation de ses soeurs cadettes.
texts.en:
Patricia is a young woman, age 31, who lives in one of the neighborhoods of the capital city.  She has a family and runs a beauty salon in her neighborhood.

Thanks to her skillfulness, Patricia has attracted an increasing number of customers, whose needs she would still like to satisfy.  To this end, and in order to increase her inventory, she is requesting a loan which will be used to buy hair extensions, hair weaves, straighteners, and other products.

The profits generated thanks to this loan will help her to expand her business, hire an assistant, take care of her family's needs, and most importantly, to cover her younger sisters' school fees.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, hair weaves and straighteners.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
This is Vicenta, 49, resident of Dasmariñas, Philippines. She is married to Jaime and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Vicenta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP (Philippine Peso) worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Vicenta earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Vicenta hopes to give her children a good and quality education and dreams to have a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Abrahan Jose
