texts.es: El cliente Abrahán José, es un señor de 24 años de edad, está casado con la señora Alejandra, el cliente trabaja en una microempresa que se dedica a hacer carpeta asfáltica, el cargo que ocupa es de peón, actualmente la cliente vive por la zona sur de la ciudad de Cochabamba, aproximadamente a 20 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde vive el cliente es propia, el cliente vive con su esposa y su cuñada, ambos tienen 2 hijos dependientes y el destino del nuevo crédito de la institución es para la compra de mercadería ya que su esposa del cliente se dedica a vender ropa en los mercados de la ciudad, ya que la cliente con la mercadería que tiene no es suficiente para la venta, tiene muy poco mercadería para la venta y con la compra de más mercadería tendrá más ingresos y de alguna u otra manera podrá satisfacer sus necesidades que tiene en su familia, es por lo cual reflejamos esta pequeña historia de la cliente, para el conocimiento de todos ustedes.
texts.en:
Abrahán José,, a 24-year-old man, is married to Alejandra. The client works in a small business that makes asphalt. 

Currently, the client lives south of the city of Cochabamba, approximately 20 kilometers from Cochabamba. The client owns his home. He lives with his wife and his sister-in-law. Both have 2 dependent kids. 

The purpose of the new loan for the institution is to purchase merchandise since his wife sells clothing in the city markets. The merchandise she has is not enough to sell, she has very little merchandise for sale and with the purchase of more merchandise she will have more income. One way or another she will be able to satisfy the needs of her family. The reason the small story is told is so that everyone is familiar.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is a 45-year-old woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with three children the ages of 16, 20 and 22.  While her husband works as a carpenter, she supports their needs by operating a sari-sari store (small convenience store). This business has been in existence for 20 years now. She is asking for a loan of 20000 PHP to buy gasoline, fresh fish, canned goods, toiletries, milk and coffee. She hopes to buy a healthy diet for her family out of her profit. She will also use her income for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, fresh fish, canned goods, toiletries, milk and coffee

loans.name: 040107-Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bách operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase nets for fishing.

Bách is 52 years old and married with three children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 040107-Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường Solidarity Group. Bách supports one dependent with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her two other children are grown up.

This is Bách's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Bách has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Bách faces in her business is the lack of capital. In the future, Bách hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase nets for fishing

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is 51 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocked goods to sell.

Rizalina has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 19 years and also earns an income from food vending. Rizalina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocked goods to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 32 years old. She is married with a one-year-old child. She sells corn flour and beans. She has spent one and a half years in the business. She wants this loan to buy more units of corn flour and beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings for a better future.

loans.use: to buy more corn flour and beans for sale

loans.name: Izdehar

texts.en: Izdehar is a 40-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy new furniture. She also wants to expand her home. In the future, Izdehar hopes to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Angelita works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Angelita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Angelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rowena has requested a PHP 26000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell. Rowena has been in this business for 25 years now and works hard to support her family. In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: CLAUDIA TIENE 33 AÑOS VIVE EN LA ZONA DE VILLA ADELA DE LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO, CUENTA CON UN SNACK DE VENTA DE POLLOS A LA BROASTER CON 2 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO. LA CLIENTE CON EL TRANSCURSO DEL TIEMPO AHORRÓ INVIRTIENDO CON UN PEQUEÑO CAPITAL CON EL CUAL FUE IMPLEMENTANDO MUEBLES PARA SU NEGOCIO. EL DINERO SOLICITADO ESTA DESTINADO A LA COMPRA DE INSUMOS Y COMPRA DE MENAJE DE COCINA, EN CUANTO A SU EXPERIENCIA QUIERE AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO Y SU NIVEL DE INGRESOS, CUENTA CON ACTITUD DE PAGO Y BUEN EMPRENDIMIENTO EN LA ADMINISTRACIÓN DE SU NEGOCIO YA QUE LA CLIENTE SOBRESALIÓ SOLA A PESAR DE TENER 1 HIJO RECIÉN NACIDO, AL CUAL MANTIENE CON LOS RECURSOS DE SU NEGOCIO, REALIZANDO UN SACRIFICIO DE PROVEERSE DE LOS INSUMOS A TEMPRANAS HORAS DE LA MAÑANA, Y LA ATENCIÓN DEL NEGOCIO POR LAS NOCHES.
texts.en: Claudia, 33, lives in the Villa Adela neighborhood of the city of El Alto.  She has a shop where she sells roasted chicken.  She has 2 years of experience in this line of work.  Over time, she has been saving money and she invested a small amount of capital in the purchase of furniture for her business.  She will use the funds from this loan to buy supplies and kitchenware. With her experience, she wants to expand her business and increase her income.  She has a good attitude towards payment and is very entrepreneurial in the administration of her business.  She has succeeded in spite of having a newborn baby, who she supports with the income from her business, making the sacrifice to stock up her business with supplies in the early hours of the morning and to tend to her business at night.

loans.use: to buy supplies and kitchenware

loans.name: Sheron

texts.en: Sheron, 30, is married to a tailor and they have one child, age four. He sells skirts and trousers and has spent eight years in the business. He wants this loan to buy more skirts to sell. The profits from the business will be saved for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more skirts to sell

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. 

Annie has been in this business for eight years. Annie earns more income from food vending.

Annie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
This is Jean. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jean hopes that her business grows into a mini-grocery. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and other products to sell

loans.name: Allen

texts.en: Allen is married with four children, and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She has a retail business and has been in this business for 10 years. She sells to all categories of people. She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and small cans of cooking oil. She generates additional income through selling piped water. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include off and on electricity, seasonality, transportation, and defaulters.  She aspires to own a wholesale shop and also to buy a delivery van for transportation purposes. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and small cans of cooking oil

loans.name: Felma

texts.en:
Felma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Felma has been in this business for 10 years. Felma earns more income from fishing.

Felma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 54 years old and married with four children.

Cecilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Cecilia has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns additional income from selling rice.

Cecilia aspires to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling rice and food vending. Delia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for her tailoring business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
As a married parent of 2 children, Geraldine works hard to support her family.

She has a dry goods business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling rice. Geraldine is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell for her dry goods business.

Geraldine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cell phones to sell

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 28 years old. She is married and has one child. She has been selling charcoal for the past couple months, which she added to the foodstuffs she has been selling. She wants this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal for sale. The profits from the business will be used for building a house.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Paulo

texts.es: El señor Paulo  tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su esposa y tiene una  hija de 14 años de edad que depende de ellos, esta estudiando en el colegio de nuestra ciudad de Monteagudo, porque  en la comunidad ya no existe el curso para que continúe estudiando y vive sola en la casa de sus Abuelos que sacaron como anticrético. Sus padres viven en la comunidad el Puente ubicado a unos 140 km de la Ciudad de Monteagudo, Su principal actividad es la agricultura aunque  hoy en día es muy riesgosa debido a que  los factores climáticos perjudican  en el ciclo productivo que afectan en  los rendimientos, porque a veces no se recupera los costos de producción. Es por eso que también obtiene ingresos por la cría y venta de  ganado vacuno para así poder obtener  ingresos extras y cubrir todos sus gastos. El préstamo será destinado para la compra de semilla hibrida de maíz, agroquímicos, alambre para el encerrado del potrero y pago de mano de mano de obra del personal eventual  ya que él no cuenta con recursos suficientes para poder empezar a preparar sus terreno y realizar la siembra.
texts.en: Paulo is 36 years old and lives with his wife. They have a 14 year-old daughter who is dependent on them, though she is studying at a high school in the city of Monteagudo because there was no way for her to continue her education in their community. She lives alone in her grandparents' house, which they have through an anticrético arrangement. Her parents live in the community of El Puente, which is located some 140 kilometers from the city of Monteagudo. Paulo's principal activity is agriculture, although these days it is very risky because he doesn't always recover his production costs due to climatic factors that can hurt the growing cycle and affect yields. For this reason, he also raises and sells cattle to earn extra income and cover his expenses. He will use this loan to buy hybrid corn seeds, agrochemicals, and wire for enclosing his pastures, and eventually to pay for labor because he does not have sufficient resources to be able to ready his land and complete the planting.

loans.use: to pay for hybrid corn seeds, agrochemicals, wire, and labor

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 42 years old, single and blessed with three school going children. She has been running a food stall whereby she makes a variety of foods and sells to her customers. She has been in this business for the past year in Narok area, earning a monthly income of  20,000 KES (Kenyan Shilling). 


She has applied for her second loan of 25,000 KES from KADET LTD which she intends to use to renovate her premise and replace her cookery gear.


Doris intends to use the profits gained to reinvest and grow the business. Her future plan is to become a large scale outlet.

loans.use: to renovate her premise and replace her cookery gear.

loans.name: Pastor

texts.es: EL SEÑOR PASTOR,  VIVE EN LA COMUNIDAD DE VILLA MODERNA DE LA  PROVINCIA DE MIZQUE DEL DEPARTAMENTO DE COCHABAMBA,  PASTOR  SE DEDICA A TRABAJAR EN LA AGRICULTURA Y EN TIEMPO LIBRE  A REALIZAR TRABAJOS DE JORNALERO CON SU YUNTA DE BUEYES EN LA ZONA PARA GANARSE UNOS CENTAVOS Y ASÍ PODER MANTENERSE EN LA ANTERIOR COSECHA TUVO PROBLEMAS CLIMÁTICOS  DE SEQUÍA Y HELADAS, POR EFECTO, LAS AGUAS  DE RIEGO BAJARON DE CAUDAL AFECTANDO AL RENDIMIENTO DE LA PRODUCCIÓN, ESTE DESASTRE HIZO FRACASAR EN SUS INGRESOS ECONÓMICOS A LA FAMILIA QUE SE MANTENÍAN CON LA PRODUCCIÓN AGRÍCOLA. CADA AÑO PRODUCEN PRINCIPALMENTE CEBOLLA, ZANAHORIA Y MAÍZ, COMO EL MAIZ SIRVE DE FORRAJE ES IMPRESCINDIBLE PARA LA ALIMENTACIÓN DEL GANADO VACUNO. PASTOR ES UNA PERSONA  MUY QUERIDA Y RESPETADA EN EL LUGAR DONDE VIVE, ÉL  ESTÁ SOLICITANDO EL CRÉDITO PARA AMPLIAR SU VIVIENDA, DE ESTA MANERA MEJORARÁ LA CALIDAD DE VIDA. TRABAJA EN LAS PEQUEÑAS PARCELAS QUE TIENE CON SU ESPOSA, TAMBIÉN TIENE LA CLARA IDEA DE QUE CON ESTE CRÉDITO MEJORARÁ LAS CONDICIONES Y QUE EN LAS PRÓXIMAS OPORTUNIDADES REALIZARA INVERSIONES CON CRÉDITOS MAYORES QUE LE PERMITAN EMPRENDER NEGOCIOS CON UTILIDADES DE MAYOR VALOR ECONÓMICO.
texts.en:
Pastor lives in the community of Villa Moderna in Mizque Province, Cochabamba Department. He works in agriculture and in his free time he works around the area as a day laborer with his team of oxen, in order to earn a few centavos and be able to subsist. He suffered climatic problems with his last harvest, as drought and freezing caused the irrigation waters to fall, therefore affecting his production. This disaster meant an economic failure for his family, who relied on the agricultural production. Every year, they principally produce onions, carrots, and corn. Since the corn serves as fodder, it is essential for feeding Pastor's cattle.

Pastor is a very beloved and respected person in the place where he lives. He is requesting this loan to expand his dwelling, in order to improve his family's quality of life. He works on small parcels of land that he and his wife have. He also has a clear idea that he will improve their conditions with this loan and with subsequent opportunities and greater loans, he will make investments that will allow him to learn a business with higher profits.

loans.use: to expand his family's dwelling

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 46 years old and married with 8 children.

Helen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a spice business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more spices to sell.

Helen has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the spice business for one year and also earns an income from a general store.

Helen aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more spices to sell

loans.name: Chainy

texts.en:
Chainy is 48 years old and married with 5 children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Chainy is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Chainy has been farming rice for 30 years and also earns additional income from duck raising.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta describes herself as a hardworking and industrious woman. She raises hogs and sells bananas within the village she lives in. Violeta's dream pushes her to strive hard to get ahead in life. She is grateful because she is able to cover their household expenditures through the gained profits from selling bananas. For now, she has been raising four animals for fattening as her additional source of income.

Violeta and her spouse have been doing their best in order to increase their income. The couple knows that they could obtain their dream in life through proper management and dedication to business. It's been ten years up to now of hard work and patience she has devoted to her business buying and selling bananas. Her business is growing, yet she still wants to have continuous development of the business for her to educate all her six children. 

Violeta would like to apply for additional capital amounting to PHP 11,000 to allow her to buy more bananas. She's hoping for approval of this loan amount.

loans.use: to buy more bananas for her vending activity

loans.name: Colleen

texts.en:
Colleen is 31 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Colleen is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Colleen has been farming rice for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store and restaurant.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita grew up within the village of Pinto Alfonso Lista. Most of the primary source of income of the people there is farming, particularly planting corn crops.

Lolita owns and has operated her variety store for ten years, and one year for her school canteen. Aside from the retail store, Lolita is also engaged in the livestock business. Nowadays, she is raising four animals for fattening. Lolita would like to increase the amount of her biscuits, spices, canned goods and soft drinks because it is marketable to her village and school, but her funds are insufficient so she is applying for a loan of PHP 13,000 which will be used for the development of her variety store.

loans.use: to buy marketable merchandise for her variety store

loans.name: Delfin

texts.en:
Livestock has been the business involvement of Delfin. He has operated this kind of business for three years while ten years for his corn field. Right now he grows corn crops on his two hectares of farm plot. Delfin is 32 years of age, married with two children who currently go to school.

Delfin plans to purchase sacks of hog feed, vitamins and vaccines to ensure proper growth of his raised hogs. But due to the high cost of these livestock supplies, he is requesting additional working capital of PHP 8000. He hopes that his raised hogs will be free from any diseases so he could raise them well to reach their optimum growth. Delfin knows that his success in life relies on his own capacity to handle the livestock business. He is hoping for continuous access to financial assistance to be able to educate his two children and give them a better way of living.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines for his raised hogs

loans.name: Intisar

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons Intisar prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Intisar is a 33-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan who has 4 family members. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to buy toilet paper to resell in the same area. In the future she wants to expand her project.

loans.use: to buy toilet paper to resell

loans.name: Santa Catalina De Sillacancha Group

texts.es: La socia es la señora Gabriela, la socia es una señora de 50 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, él mayor de ellos es profesional, el segundo está en la universidad y los 2 menores en la escuela.  Gabriela  como todas sus compañeras del grupo tiene varias actividades en común, entre las cuales está la agricultura, en la producción y venta de verduras y frutas,  y en la crianza de animales menores como gallinas, cuyes y cerdos. Gabriela como el resto de sus compañeras del grupo están solicitando su préstamo para invertirlo como capital de trabajo y comprar semilla para sus cultivos y también comprar animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, y cerdos, por ello las socias están muy agradecidas con  KIVA, por ayudarlas a fortalecer y hacer crecer sus actividades económica. La señora  Gabriela esta vestida de chompa verde limón, al extremo central izquierdo de la foto de grupo. Gabriela pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Catalina de Sillacancha”; del distrito de Sillacancha de la provincia de Calca del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
The borrower is Gabriela. She is 50 years old, married and has four children. The oldest is a professional the second is at university and the two youngest are at school. Gabriela, like all of her companions in the group, has various sources of income, one of which is agriculture: growing and selling fruit and vegetables and raising small animals such as chickens, guinea pigs and pigs. 

Gabriela, like the rest of the group members, is asking for a loan in order to invest it it the purchase of seed for her crops and also to buy small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and pigs. All the group members are very grateful to Kiva for helping them to consolidate their business.  Gabriela is wearing a lime-green jumper, at the centre left of the group photo. She belongs to the communal bank “Santa Catalina de Sillacancha,” from the district of Sillacancha of the province of Calca del Cusco – Perú.

loans.use: to buy seed for her crops and to buy small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Robino

texts.en:
Robino is a 26-year-old single gentleman. He is a maize vendor, who operates a maize store and transports the grain to various schools in Narok town. He has been running this business for the past two years, making a monthly income of KES 10,000.

He has borrowed a second loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to pay for the transportation of maize to various schools. 

The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost business. His future dream is to improve his living standard by acquiring a pickup for his business.

loans.use: to pay for maize transport to various schools.

loans.name: Anarkhan

texts.ru:
Анархан 43 года, замужем, недавно Анарахан стала мамой в четвертый раз. Анархан в качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, в 2008 году начала заниматься торговлей продуктами питания, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 15,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Анархан, она смогла выкупить торговое место и оборудовать необходимыми принадлежностями. Учитывая тот факт, что в настоящее время Анархан заботится о новорожденном малыше, ее супруг помогает в торговле и заботе о старших детях.  Ежемесячная прибыль от бизнеса составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анархан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS)  на расширение ассортимента товаров, в частности на закуп партии чая, сахара и муки, и также товары повседневного спроса для дома.  Доходы от кредита Анархан планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса, чтобы накопить сумму на обучение своего сына в ВУЗе.
texts.en:
Anarkhan is a 43-year-old married woman, who just had her fourth child. In 2008, Anarkhan, an income provider in her family, started her own small grocery business with a sum of only 15,000 som. Thanks to her persistent work, she was able to purchase a space for the business and to find the necessary equipment. Anarkhan is busy taking care of their new child now, so, her husband is now helping her with the store and the care of their other children. 

The monthly income from Anarkhan's business is around 10,000 som. With the goal of long-term business development, Anarkhan has requested a 110,000 som loan from "Bai-Tushum and Partners". She wants this loan to diversify her product selection. Specifically, she would like to purchase tea, sugar, flour, and consumer goods for the home. Anarkhan plans to use the return from this loan to invest in her business, which will ultimately help her save for her son's university education.

loans.use: to purchase tea, sugar and flour for resale

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel, es casado y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar; viven en casa propia ocupando tres habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como decorador de interiores por más de ocho horas al día ya que es el único que cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de insumos de gastronomía (verduras, papas, carne, cebollas, etc.) para su hija ya que estudia en un instituto de enseñanza de educación culinaria , pues ella tiene que presentar unos platos como examen y con lo poco que Abel  gana no le alcanza.
El sueño de Abel, es mejorar sus ingresos y poder cubrir los gastos de educación de sus hijos ya que no cuenta con más ingresos por que su esposa se fue al exterior.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con  KIVA.
texts.en:
Abel is married and has two children who are in school. They live in their own home which consists of three rooms. The house is located in the District of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz.

Abel currently works as an interior decorator for more than eight hours a day. This is the only job he has in order to cover the cost of food, education, and basic services for his family. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy supplies (vegetables, potatoes, meat, onions, and other items) for the gastronomy courses that his daughter is taking at a culinary institute. She has to present a few dishes for her exam, but Abel is not able to cover this expense with what little he earns.

Abel’s dream is to improve his earnings so that he can pay for his children’s educational expenses. He does not have access to additional income because his wife moved abroad. This is the second time he has requested a loan from IMPRO, but the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his daughter's gastronomy courses.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita works hard to support her children. She is married and has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines.

Purita requested a PHP 6,500 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Purita is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en:
Saroeurn is 54 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables and crickets for more than four years, earning approximately $6 daily. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) helps her run the business. All of her children are employed. 

She has asked for a loan of $1,000 to purchase timbers to rebuild her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase timbers to rebuild her house.

loans.name: Josee

texts.en:
Josee is aged 36. She is married and has three children aged between six and 12 years. She owns a hardware store and has been running the business for 10 years. 

She wants this loan to buy more hardware items to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more hardware items to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her fruits and vegetables retail business.

Lolita has been in this business for 12 years. Lolita earns additional income from raising pigs.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Gloriose

texts.en: Gloriose is 35 years old. She is married, with one child aged three. Her child goes to school. She sells toys, cell phones and accessories. Gloriose has been running this business for one year. She wants this loan to buy more toys to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for her child’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more toys to sell.

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en:
Desideria is a 46-year-old woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with eight children aged between one and 18. 
 
To support her family, she is presently growing rice and investing in a food business in their locality. She makes polvoron (a powdered milk candy, made of flour, sugar butter and powdered milk).  

As of now, Desideria lacks the additional capital for her business and she is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP in order for her to buy flour for polvoron and fertilizer for her farm. 

She hopes that her business will improve and will expand in the future thus giving her the opportunity to earn more for her to reinvest, save, renovate her house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy flour to make polvoron and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 47 years old and married with eight children.

Marina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store.

Marina has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from charcoal retail.

Marina aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 32 years old and married with six children.

Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a dried coconut meat retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Mary Jane has borrowed and paid back 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the dried coconut meat retail for eight years and also earns an income from pig-fattening.

Mary Jane aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Antony has been in farming for three years producing both poultry and maize for the local market. He works as a tailor for additional income.

Antony has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilmo to buy poultry birds. He says this will give boost to his farming business. He is glad to have joined Juhudi Kilimo and says farming has been his sole source of income.

Antony however says animal diseases especially poultry diseases are the main challenge.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: 0201007 Thôn 3 _ Hoằng Đông Group

texts.en:
Thiện is 40 years old and she is married with three children. Thiện supports her three dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. 

Mrs. Thiện works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle. Thiện has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thiện faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise.

She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 0201007 Thôn 3 - Hoằng Đông solidarity group. In 2002, Thiện joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thiện has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Thiện hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sea-food retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more sea-food to sell to customers.

NWTF is re-listing Aileen's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Christina works hard to support her family.

She has a rice-retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Christina is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more rice to sell

Christina has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en:
Therese is 58 years old. She is married and has two children aged between 24 and 27 years, all were enrolled in high schools. She sells potatoes and has spent 12 years in the business. 

She wants this loan to buy more potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes to sell.

loans.name: 3.9.186.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Gái operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. Gái has been involved in this business for 8 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell. 

Gái is 42 years old and she is married with two children. Gái Dương doesn't support any dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Gái is the group leader of the 3.9.186.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

In 2010, Gái joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Gái has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Gái hopes for her business to do well, to buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Limber

texts.es: El cliente Limber, es un señor de 23 años de edad, está casado con  la señora Aurora, el cliente trabaja en su mismo domicilio, el cliente tiene un taller donde fabrica charrangos, actualmente el cliente vive por la zona sur de la ciudad de Cochabamba, aproximadamente a 6 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde vive el cliente no es propia, el cliente vive con su esposa en alquiler, ambos tienen 2 hijos dependientes y el destino del nuevo crédito de la institución es para la compra de material para la elaboración de charrangos, ya que el cliente con el material que tiene no es suficiente para la elaboración y venta, tiene muy pocos productos terminados para la venta y con la compra de más material tendrá más ingresos y de alguna u otra manera podrá satisfacer sus necesidades que tiene en su familia, ya que en este momento su esposa también trabaja con el cliente, es por lo cual reflejamos esta pequeña historia del cliente, para el conocimiento de todos ustedes.
texts.en: Limber is 23 years old, married to Aurora and works out of his own home, where he has a workshop for making charangos (small wooden guitars). He currently lives about 6 kilometers south of the city of Cochabamba. He rents the home with his wife, with whom he has two children. He plans to use the loan to purchase materials to make the charangos, since he currently does not have sufficient supplies to make and sell them. He has very few products ready for sale, and with the purchase of more materials he will be able to generate more income and one way or another be able to meet the needs of his family. At the moment, his wife is also working with him, and we are providing this little history so you can get to know both of them better.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make wooden instruments.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing materials for her business.

Vilma has been in this business for three years. Vilma earns additional income from charcoal retail.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 34 years old and has five children. Analyn is married and has one child who is in school.

Analyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and medicines for her pigs.

Analyn has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Analyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: El señor Nicolas, según referencias de sus vecinos e inquilinos, se pudo afirmar que es una persona tranquila y trabajador, curso hasta la primaria, no pudo concluir el bachillerato por problemas económicos, viéndose en la necesidad de buscar trabajo y por tanto dejar de lado los estudios; actualmente está separado por más de 15 años de su ex esposa, es por ese motivo que llega a la ciudad en busca de mejores oportunidades desde entonces trabaja como impresor en un periódico de renombre, actualmente el Sr. Nicolás vive en condición de alquilado, no cuenta con una casa propia, lo que espera que a un futuro no muy lejano pueda comprar ya que tiene la esperanza de formar una nueva familia por esa razón solicita el crédito con el fin de poder emprender un negocio el de la comida rápida que este deseaba volver a emprender ya que hace años se dedicaba a esta actividad y nos comenta que tiene experiencia en el mismo es así que con el crédito otorgado pretende comprar una brostera ya que este espera tener buenos ingresos por la comercialización de este; ayudando así a poder llevar una vida más digna y de esa forma sentirse más satisfecho de haber logrado lo que quiso.
texts.en: Nicolas, according to his neighbors' references, is a tranquil and hardworking person. He has a primary-school education and couldn't pursue his studies because financial problems forced him to look for work. He has been separated from his ex-wife for more than 15 years, which led him to come to the city looking for better opportunities. Since then he has worked as a printer for a well-known publication. He currently is renting and does not own his home, but he hopes to be able to buy one in the not-too-distant future because he has the goal of forming a new family. He is requesting the loan to open a fast-food business, since he made a living in the business years ago. He tells us that his experience is such that with the loan he can purchase a deep-frier and make a good income putting it to use. This will help him gain a more dignified life and he can feel more satisfied with what he has achieved.

loans.use: to purchase a deep-frier to make fried chicken.

loans.name: 09.01.10 Phú Sơn 3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan has a retail business selling dry food. Lan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase household commodities in general to resell.

Lan is 54 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent child, another is grown up. 

She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 09.01.10 Phú Sơn 3 solidarity group. This is Lan first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With her business profit, Lan hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase household commodities in general to resell.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 21 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Vivian runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Vivian has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, spices, egg, snack foods, soap, etc.. 

In the future Vivian would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 51 years old from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with eight children aged between ten and 32. 
 
She has been in the fishing business for 30 years working alongside her husband to support their family. The business is a lucrative one and she wants to make a further investment in it. However, Elsa doesn’t have enough capital for the sustainability of her business. 

At this time, she is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy wood and paint and pay for boat maintenance. Elsa hopes that she can expand her ventures and earn as much as she can so that she will be able to save and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy wood and paint and pay for boat maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to resell.

loans.name: Juan Guillermo

texts.es:
Juan Guillermo es un joven de 24 años que comenzó a trabajar en una tienda general desde hace muchos años, pues su hermano mayor tenía un negocio de estos y se lo enseñó a trabajar para generar sus propios recursos. Luego de muchos años trabajando con su hermano, este le dejó la tienda general para que la trabajara el solo y le pudiera ir mejor, así podría generar más ingresos para pagar sus estudios. Gracias a que la tienda actualmente ha tenido buenas ventas, su familia ha podido ir superando grandes dificultades económicas, además que las dificultades de salud de sus padres también se han ido mejorando. Sin embargo, en el momento está atravesando una gran dificultad y no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder surtir su negocio, es por esto que busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y surtir su negocio con productos que ya se han ido agotando.

Su sueño es poder aumentar sus ingresos para salir de la difícil situación económica en su hogar y también que mejore la salud de sus padres. Además aspira a poder generar empleo en su tienda para una persona muy necesitada.
texts.en: Juan Guillermo is a young man of 24 who started working in a general store many years ago, since his older brother had one and taught him how to work so he could generate his own income. After many years of working with his brother, he left to go work on his own to try to make things better, and in this way he could earn more income to pay for his education. Thanks to his store currently having strong sales, his family has been able to overcome big financial hurdles, and his parents' health problems have also been improving. Even so, at the moment he is still facing a big problem and does not have enough money to stock his store. It is for this reason he is requesting a loan to purchase grocery supplies and stock his store with products that are already running low. His dream is to able to increase his income to overcome the difficult financial situation at home and also improve his parents' health. He also hopes to be able to hire a much-needed employee at the store.

loans.use: to purchase grocery supplies and restock his business with products that are running low.

loans.name: 3.9.187.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiệp operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell. Hiệp has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Hiệp is 29 years old and she is married with two children. Hiệp supports two dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. 

Hiệp is the group leader of the 3.9.187.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of three members. In 2010, Hiệp joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hiệp has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Hiệp hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: 09.01.09 Phú Sơn3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh has a retail business selling processed food such as pig roll. Thanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Thanh faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make the processed food to sell. 

Thanh is 51 years old and she is married with two children. Thanh lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province, her children are grown up.

Thanh is the group leader of the 09.01.09 Phú Sơn3 solidarity group, which consists of four members. This is Thanh first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. In the future, Thanh hopes for her children to do well in school, to build a new house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

loans.name: Shiren

texts.en:
Shiren is a 20-year-old married woman from Ashrafia Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay her tuition costs. She hopes to continue her higher education in the future.

Since Shiren is under 30 year old her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay her tuition costs.

loans.name: Srey Da

texts.en:
Srey Da is 25 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is employed in the post office. He earns about $5 daily. 

Srey Da is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase windows and doors to install in her house in order to finish the construction. In the future, she would like to run a clothes shop and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase windows and doors to install in her house.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio, of San Miguel, is 45 years old. He has been farming rice and fishing for 20 years now. He is married and has one son who is 18 years old. Florencio wants the best for his family. Aside from his businesses, he also supports his wife's business which is a general store. 

Florencio does not want to stop there. Together with his wife, they work hard on the farm for a better income. This earns him 3,000 PHP a month. He wants to do more for his business through a loan. The loan will be used to buy a fishing net and weight leads to sustain his fishing. 

He aims to have a bigger income for his family. The additional profit will go towards his family’s daily consumption and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and weight leads.

loans.name: Xaverine

texts.en:
Xaverine is aged 34. She is married. She sells bed sheets, curtains and bed covers. She has spent 10 years in the business. 

She wants this loan to buy more bed sheets and curtains for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To purchase additional bed sheets and curtains for sale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria tiene una papelería desde hace unos 11 años cuando fue abandonada por su esposo y se vio en la obligación de responder por las obligaciones de su hogar. En un principio el negocio contaba con muy poca mercancía ya que Gloria no tenía mucho capital, pero con su esfuerzo y dedicación diaria ha venido sacándolo adelante y mejorando sus ingresos. En la actualidad tiene una gran dificultad económica que le ha causado que su familia tenga que padecer por una muy mala calidad de vida, por esto es que busca mejorar esta situación con un préstamo para comprar surtido de papelería y poder ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes para mejorar sus ventas.

Su sueño es poder aumentar sus ingresos y brindar en su hogar una mejor calidad de vida para superar esta dura etapa por la que está atravesando.
texts.en: Gloria started her stationery store 11 years ago when her husband left her and the responsibilities of providing for the household fell on her shoulders. At first the business had very few supplies since Gloria didn't have much capital, but with her hard work and dedication she kept moving forward and increasing her income. She currently is under great financial stress, which has caused her family to live with a very poor quality of life, and she hopes to improve the situation with a loan so she can stock her store and be able to offer a wider variety of products to her customers and increase her sales. Her dream is to increase her income and provide her household with a better quality of life so they can overcome this tough period they are experiencing.

loans.use: to purchase paper supplies to offer a wider variety of products.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 30 years old, married and blessed with two children that he supports. He has operated a motorcycle transport business for the past three years with a monthly profit of KES 10,000

He has applied for his first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET Ltd. and he plans to repair his broken motorbike. This will facilitate him to operate within a wider coverage. 

He intends to use the anticipated profits to support his business and diversify into livestock rearing. His future dreams is to have a stable business and improve the family living standards.

loans.use: to repair his broken motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a thirty-five-year-old farmer in Nkubu  area in Kenya. She is married with two children who are both schooling. She has been in farming for over fifteen years producing maize, beans, milk and peas that she sells to the people in her local area.

Irene is requesting 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry to enhance her income so she will be able to use her money to educate her children through to college in future. Her main challenge is high cost of feeds.

Irene requests Juhudi Kilimo to lower their interest rates for paying up the loans.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: 09.01.02 Phú Sơn3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhung works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Nhung has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Nhung faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Nhung is 39 years old and she is married with two children. Nhung lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Nhung is the group leader of the 09.01.02 Phú Sơn3 solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

In 2012, Nhung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Nhung has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Nhung hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 60208-Tiền Phong - Hoằng Châu Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thảo works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Thảo has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thảo faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase chickens and pigs to raise. 

Thảo is 41 years old and she is married with two children. Thảo supports one dependent with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province, another child is grown up.

She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 60208-Tiền Phong - Hoằng Châu solidarity group. In 2004, Thảo joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thảo has successfully repaid eight loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Thảo hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and pigs to raise.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella has been busy growing her business since her last Kiva loan in 2009.  

To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Stella to generate greater profits and manage to pay school fees for her children. Stella hopes that in the future she will be able to increase sales and get enough profits so as to complete her house. 

Stella is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Stella who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Edinson

texts.es:
Edinson anteriormente se estaba dedicando a la venta de alimentos en un triciclo de su propiedad, pero ahora al ver que este negocio no le estaba generando los ingresos necesarios para su sostenimiento, ha decidido comenzar con la venta de frutas y verduras. Las dificultades económicas en su hogar están empeorando cada vez más y su esposa y sus 4 hijos ya están sufriendo grandes consecuencias de esto. Es por esto que ahora buscando mejorar esta condición, Edinson busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de verduras y frutas y comenzar con el negocio de venta de estos productos.

Su sueño es poder mejorar su condición económica a través de este negocio que genera mejores ingresos y en un futuro ubicarse en un local propio.
texts.en:
Edinson was previously selling food on a tricycle of his own, but now, seeing that this business was not generating enough income to support himself, he has decided to start selling fruits and vegetables. The economic difficulties at his home are getting worse every time and his wife and his four children are already suffering big consequences because of this.

This is why now, looking to improve this condition, Edinson seeks a loan to buy an assortment of vegetables and fruits and start with the business of selling these products.

His dream is to be able to improve his economic condition through this business, which generates better income, and in the future work in his own establishment.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of vegetables and fruits and start with the business of selling these products.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 55 years old, married to Grace and has been blessed with two children that he supports. He has operated a taxi transport business for the last 22 years getting a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

This is his first loan of KES 50,000 from KADET Ltd. and he intends to do a full service to his pickup. He plans to use the anticipated profits to increase his operation area. 

His future dreams are to have a sustainable business and own a residential plot.

loans.use: to pay for a full service to his pick-up.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise, age 49, is married and has five children between 12 and 24 years of age. She has been running a retail business of different foodstuffs in the past years, but now she wants to set up a hardware business as a joint business. She wants this loan to add more items such as locks and lumps for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more hardware items for sale

loans.name: 09.01.04 Phú Sơn3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Diệu has a retail business selling construction material. She is requesting a loan to purchase construction material for resell.

Diệu is 64 years old, and she is married with two children. Diệu is the group leader of the 09.01.04 Phú Sơn3 solidarity group, which consists of six members. Diệu lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in the Thanh Hoa province. Her children are grown up.

This is Diệu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Diệu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Diệu faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Diệu hopes for her children to find a good job, to remodel her house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase construction material for resell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is 57 years old and married with two adult sons. She has been engaged in the food vending business for 20 years. She sells home-cooked dishes. She is asking for a loan to buy meat, vegetables and seasoning. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's diet, save for the future and reinvest in the same business. She hopes to improve her menu so she can attract more customers in the future.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables and seasoning

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: La Sr. Erika tiene 37 años de edad, es soltera, es Auxiliar en Enfermería hace más de 4 años, ella vive con sus padres quienes  necesitan el apoyo moral y económico de la cliente, por ello la cliente les apoya y no se aleja de ellos , pues fue ese uno de los motivo que le impulsaron a emprender en la actividad de comercio en la venta de ropa casual de vestir conocida ya por muchos de sus clientes y compañeros de trabajo a quienes vende su producto; es por tal motivo que hoy solicita el crédito para poder comprar más mercadería y de alguna forma mejorar sus ingresos que tiene pudiendo así ayudar a su familia económicamente ya que con el crédito otorgado  le será más fácil lograr esto y por ende concretar los sueños que tiene como el de comprar un terreno y consolidar a futuro una familia, además de sentirse más satisfecha de haber logrado lo que quiso y ver a su queridos padres felices por lo que su hija pudo realizar.
texts.en:
Erika is 37 years old, single and has been a nursing assistant for more than four years. She lives with her parents who need the client’s moral and financial support, so she helps them and doesn’t drift away from them. That was one of the reasons that prompted her to engage in her commercial activity of selling casual clothing. 

She is known by her clients and coworkers to whom she sells her products. It is for this reason that today she is asking for a loan to be able to buy more merchandise and somehow improve her income so that she can help her family financially since with the granted loan it will be easier to achieve this and as a consequence attain her dreams such as buying land and building a secure future for her family. In addition to that she wants the increased satisfaction of having achieved her goals and to see her beloved parents happy for what their daughter could do.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in order to expand her sales inventory of casual clothing

loans.name: 60317-Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lài works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise.

Lài is 55 years old, and she is married with three children. She is the leader of a three-member group, the 60317-Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường solidarity group. Lài supports one dependent with her business in the Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in the Thanh Hoa province. Her two other children are grown up.

In 2005, Lài joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lài has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lài has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. In the future, Lài hopes for her children to do well in school, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more hot dogs to resell

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: El sr. Manuel  tiene 23 años de edad vive con sus papas y hermanos, ellos vivían en el departamento de Chuquisaca en la población de yamparaez como hace 23 años tuvieron que venirse a la población de Santa Rosa Ñ donde habitan hace 20 años, de la provincia Tiraque, en el departamento de Cochabamba, él se encuentra Soltero viviendo junto a su padre y hermanos,  Manuel se dedica al Trabajo como jornalero realizando los chaqueos en la misma población de santa rosa Ñ para las plantaciones de arroz, plátano y yuca, él se volvió a levantar  junto a su padre tomaron un nuevo rumbo en su camino empezaron  de cero.  El préstamo que solicita Manuel es para la compra de lote agrícola así podrá tener mas ingreso económicos y de esa manera podrá ayudar a su padre y madre, pero él tendrá en un futuro sus hijos que si puedan realizar una carrera y poder ayudar a las personas de la zona.
texts.en:
Manuel, 23, is single and lives with his parents and siblings.  They used to live in the department of Chuquisaca in the community of Yamparaez about 23 years ago, but they had to come to Santa Rosa Ñ, in the province of Tiraque in the department of Cochabamba, where they've lived for 20 years.

Manuel works as a day laborer doing the slash-and-burn preparation of land on rice, banana, and yucca farms.  He and his father lifted themselves up and set out on a new path, starting from scratch.

The loan that Manuel is requesting is to buy a plot of land to farm so he'll be able to have more income and help his father and mother.

In the future he'll have children who will be able to have a career and help people in the region.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to farm

loans.name: Luz Albany

texts.es:
Luz Albany comenzó a trabajar desde que salió del colegio en diferentes almacenes de venta de productos de uso personal, de allí adquirió una gran experiencia y también fue muy juiciosa con sus pagos, pues consiguió tener unos ahorros con los cuales decidió montar su propio negocio, el cual es un almacén ubicado cerca del parque principal de su municipio y esto le permite tener muy buena ubicación. Actualmente Luz Albany se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijas de 8 y 12 años de edad y para ofrecerles una buena calidad de vida se esfuerza arduamente todos los días en su negocio. Como el local donde tiene ubicado su negocio es muy amplio, Luz Albany busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y surtir su negocio para aprovechar el amplio espacio con el que cuenta.

Su sueño es tener un gran negocio y poder tener unos buenos ingresos para progresar económicamente con su familia. Además de tener la oportunidad de brindarle a sus 2 hijas una educación escolar de muy buena calidad.
texts.en:
From the time she finished secondary school, Luz Albany began working in different stores, selling personal use products.  From this, she obtained a great experience and was very wise with her income, and therefore, she acquired some savings with which she decided to start her own business.  She has a store located near the main park of her community and this allows her a very good location.  Currently, Luz Albany is married and has two daughters ages 8 and 12 and in order to provide them with a good quality of life, she arduously exerts herself everyday at her business.  Since the shop where she has her business is quite large, Luz Albany is looking for a loan to purchase more personal use products to stock her business in order to take advantage of the ample space she has available. 

Her dream is to have a great business and to be able to have a good income to progress economically with her family.  Moreover, she wants to have the opportunity to offer her two daughers a good quality education.

loans.use: to purchase personal use products and to stock her business to take advantage of the ample space she has available.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transportion business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricycle that she uses for her tricycle transport business. Dolores has been in this business for ten years. She earns additional income from raising livestock.

Dolores has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle

loans.name: German Emilio

texts.es:
Germán es un gran luchador de la vida que luego de haber trabajado durante muchos años como empleado, ahora quiere tener su propio negocio, generarse sus propios recursos y progresar junto a su familia. Buscando mejorar su condición de trabajo y también mejorar sus ingresos, Germán va a montar una tienda general en un espacio adecuado en su residencia, donde la idea es ofrecer a sus clientes productos de la canasta familiar. Como Germán no cuenta con el capital suficiente para surtir los primeros productos de la tienda, busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y así iniciar con su tienda general.

De esta manera aspira a superar sus dificultades económicas que se complican más por el hecho de ser cabeza de hogar de sus 2 hijos. Su sueño es sacar esta tienda adelante.
texts.en:
Germán is a great fighter for life.  After having worked for many years as an employee, now he wants to have his own business, generating his own resources and progressing together with his family.  Looking to improve his working conditions as well as his income, Germán is going to start up a general store in a space connected to his home, where the idea is to offer his customers staple goods.  Since Germán doesn't have the sufficient capital to stock the initial products of the store, he is requesting a loan to purchase staple goods, and thus start up his general store.

In this way, he aspires to overcome his financial difficulties, that are more complicated because he is the head of a household with two children.  His dream is that his store will be successful.

loans.use: to purchase staple goods and thus start up his general store.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 32 years old, married to Juddith and has been blessed with three children that he supports. He has operated a motorcycle transport business in Narok for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 25,000. 

Samuel has applied for his first loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD, and he intends to add his savings to it and start a motorcycle spare parts shop. He plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into mechanical services. His future dream is to have a large motor spare parts outlet in Bomet town.

loans.use: to start a motorcycle spare parts shop

loans.name: Lurlyn

texts.en:
Lurlyn is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children from Antequera, Bohol, Philippines. She has run a small baking shop for more than two years now. Lurlyn is in need of additional capital for the expansion of her business. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy ingredients for baking bread such as flour, butter, sugar, and milk. With this, she will be able to bake more bread to sell.

Lurlyn hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she plans to continually support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for baking bread such as flour, butter, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 57 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonila has a business making and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Leonila requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy screen, nylon, binder, and fishing equipment.

Leonila has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Leonila would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy screen, nylon, binder, and fishing equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance on her pedicab

loans.name: Ruperto

texts.en: Ruperto is a supportive head of the family. He untiringly provides sustenance to his family, especially education for his two children. Ruperto is now 35 years old and married to a housekeeper. Ruperto provides motorcycle transport services to the people in his village. From this kind of business, he earns PHP 300 each day. Now, he wants to further improve his transport services so he is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy tires and crude oil and repair existing vehicle trouble. He promises to pay back his loan and keep providing safe travel for his passengers, and it will someday lead to economic stability.

loans.use: to buy tires and crude oil and repair existing vehicle trouble

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 28 year old married woman from Ashrafia Amman Jordan who has 2 family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for home improvements, as she will be repainting her home. In the future she wants to provide her family with a good living environment.
Since Faten is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 36 years old, married, and has 3 children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Liezel has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Liezel requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as pants, t-shirts and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Liezel has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Liezel would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as pants, t-shirts and other ready-to-wear clothing for resale.

loans.name: Sariem

texts.en: Sariem is 45 years old. She is widowed and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day. In addition, she prepares krill (small shrimp) to sell to generate more income for the family when she finishes her farming. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $10 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sariem is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase piglets and fodder. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her youngest child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and fodder.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela, de 43 años, es una mujer muy amable y sobre todo muy trabajadora.  Es conviviente con su pareja con quien tienen  01 niña de 07 años de edad,  por quien trabajan duro día a día para brindarle lo mejor, tiene una casa propia en donde vive junto a su parea y su niña. El trabajo de Graciela consiste en el corte y confección de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, contando con su propias maquina de coser, ella realiza su propia creación y también refacciona las prendas de sus clientes que van con seguridad que les harán un buen trabajo. Lleva más de  07 años en éste trabajo y tiene un taller muy rustico y pequeño en su casa, trabaja sola y con los gastos del hogar le ayuda su pareja que trabaja en otras actividades.
Considera rentable su negocio por la demanda que tiene sus servicios y las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta de su trabajo pues está en su hogar y puede realizar una actividad que la mantiene ocupada y le permite sentirse una persona productiva, además le permite tener ingresos y cumplir la función de ama de casa y madre, le va muy bien ya que tiene clientes que se gano por el buen trabajo que realiza, ella tiene en mente poder poner una piscigranja en donde empezar a sembrar peces para su posterior venta. Este es el préstamo número 12 con la institución MFP, espera que le vaya bien ya que hasta ahora siempre fue una socia muy cumplida que siempre se caracterizo por la puntualidad, esta muya agradecida con lo que le dan ya que le sirve de mucho cuando tiene mayor cantidad de materiales con que trabajar.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, ella comprará materiales de costura como  tela, algodón, hilos y otros materiales para que pueda seguir con su labor y poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Graciela is 43 years old. She is a very kind person and above all hardworking. She lives with her partner with whom she has one daughter who is seven years old, for whom she works hard every day to provide the best. She has her own home where she lives with her partner and their daughter.

Graciela’s work consists of making clothing for women, men and children. She uses her own sewing machine. She makes her own creations and she also alters clothing for her customers, and they go with the security that she will do good work. She has been doing this work for more than seven years and she has a very basic and small workshop in her home. She works alone and she helps support her partner with the household expenses and other activities. She considers it profitable because of the demand for her services and the good income it allows.

She likes her work as it is done at home and she can do something that keeps her busy and permits her to feel productive. Also, it permits her to have income and fulfill the function of housewife and mother. It is going very well as she has customers that she has gained through the good work she does. She has in mind of putting in a fish farm where she can begin to raise fish for later sale.

This is her twelfth loan through MFP. She expects to do well since so far she has always been a responsible member that is always characterized by her punctuality. She is very grateful with what you have given her as it helps her a lot when she has a large quantity of material to work with.

With the requested amount of 1,000 soles, she will buy sewing materials such as fabric, cotton, thread and other supplies so she can continue with her work and be able to give better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabric, cotton, thread and other supplies for her home-based seamstress shop where she creates and alters clothing

loans.name: Coralyn

texts.en:
Coralyn is hardworking and friendly citizen of Dadda. She is 35 years old, married and has three children. Two of her children attend school and need daily allowances and payments for school projects. Her spouse is a jeepney operator. To add to the family's income, Coralyn makes peanut butter, milk and ube (purple yam) candies. She offers her products to the nearby stores and canteens. 

Coralyn has been in this business for over 10 years now. She always dreamed of increasing her sales. That is why she is borrowing a loan of PHP 50,000 to add to her revolving capital. She will buy skimmed and condensed milk, sugar, flour and plastic wrappers to use in her food selling business. The additional ingredients she will buy out of her loan will help her diversify her business and produce more delicious products to sell. Coralyn will be very happy and proud to see all her children become professionals in their chosen careers someday.
