To date, Rukhsana is a successful tailor with two stitching machines and her daughter as an assistant who helps her so she may fulfill orders in less time. 

While talking to a Kashf officer, she said her clients are increasing and she is unable to cater to the high demand. She wants a loan worth Rs.15, 000 so she can buy reels of threads, fancy buttons and some laces. She wishes to utilize her earned profits on the renovation of her home.

loans.use: To buy reels of threads, fancy buttons and some laces.

loans.name: Ajali

texts.en:
Ajali lives with his life partner and his seven children in his own house. He earns a living selling fried potatoes. He has had the business for one year and his wife assists him while he goes out to do casual jobs. 

Ajali is a man devoted to his work, energetic, and highly motivated because he loves his work. He has many goals he wants to accomplish, the first in the array of priority goals being owning a food stall. He sells outside a school where most pupils buy fried potatoes from him.

He wants to buy more potatoes and cooking oil using the requested loan. At the same time, he has faith that he will be able to give a better quality of life to his family, as they deserve.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 33 years old and from Albur, Bohol. She is married, and her husband works as a carpenter. She has woven baskets for a living for quite some time now. This business provides the needs of her family. Annabelle works hard in her source of livelihood so she can give her children, ages 2 and 12, whatever they need. 

She is asking for a loan to buy raw materials for baskets, such as buri, rattan, and nylon. The loan will give her additional capital to make her business more successful and productive. The availability of materials will boost her productivity. 

In the future, she hopes to acquire a bigger market for her finished products in order to increase her business profits.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for baskets, such as buri, rattan, and nylon.

loans.name: Om-Yousf Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om-Yousf and consists of five women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Amnh, the leader of the group, is a 54-year-old married housewife.

Om-Yousf has requested a loan of 210,000 YER from AMB. With her 50,000 YER portion of the loan Amnh intends to buy a cupboard for her bedroom. She hopes to furnish her house so as to make it more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy a cupboard for her house.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a 21-year-old married woman who lives with her husband in Baqa'a, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD from Tamweelcom to pay for new furniture. Since Laila is under thirty years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

In the future Laila hopes to buy new electrical appliances to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to pay for new furniture.

loans.name: Glady

texts.en:
Glady is 41 years old, married and lives in Buchanan, Liberia. She has seven children between the ages of 18 and 25 who are attending school and living at home.

For six years now Glady has been selling dried fish in the local market. She started out with money given to her by her husband.

Glady is requesting a 20,000 LRD loan from BRAC Liberia to buy more dried fish to sell. Her ambition is to keep her business growing.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Al-Hand Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Hand and consists of five members who are all women. All of them are friends from Sana`a, Yemen. The group took a loan of 220,000 Yemen rials (YER). 

Huda is the leader of their group. She is 42 years old and lives in Hodiedh, Yemen. Her main business is sewing ladies' fabrics. She has been in business for five years. Firstly, she sold a piece of her jewelry to buy a sewing machine. With years of experience, she now has a good command of her activity. 

She is taking a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB and intends to use her loan to better develop her business by purchasing ladies' fabrics for sewing to sell and lead to increased profits. Her profits will allow her to help meet her family’s needs. In the future, she would like to have a big sewing factory.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' fabrics for sewing.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 49 years old and lives Antequera, Bohol. She is married with four children.

Evangeline weaves and sells baskets. She is applying for a loan of 8,000 PHP from CEVI to buy the nylon and rattan needed for her baskets.

With financial support, Evangeline is optimistic about keeping her business growing. Her ambition is to pay her children’s school fees, thus giving them the opportunity that is necessary for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy the nylon and rattan needed for her baskets.

loans.name: Mastula

texts.en:
Mastula is single and has five children, all of whom go to school. She also has two of her aunt’s children living with her. She lives with her family in a house that has electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

For the past year Mastula has run a shop in the market where she sells used clothes six days a week. She also earns money from her beauty salon. Her major business challenges are transportation and the weather.

Mastula is applying for a 400,000 UGX loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of clothes to sell. Her ambition is to get a hairdryer and chairs for her salon so as to serve her customers better.

loans.use: to buy more bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mummy

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 34-year-old Mummy from Moriba Town Branch Southern Area Bo District. She is married with 2 children, ages 6 and 10. Both of her children attend school. She was a student at a hairdressing vocational training school, and after graduation she started her own business.

Mummy runs a hairdressing salon, and she sells hair cream, human hair, wave and hair vaccine. She has been running this business for 5 years. She works at the business from 7am until 6 pm, 7 days per week. She also has relatives that help her on her business. Her business is the only source of income she has. Mummy says that her business is doing well.

Mummy as requested a loan in order to buy more hair product like hair cream, human hair, wave and hair vaccine. The extra income from this loan will allow her to give her children quality education. In the future, she wants to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more hair products like hair cream, human hair, wave and hair vaccine.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 26 years old and married with two children, ages 4 and 7 years. She runs a cosmetics business in Torkpoi Town in the southern area Bo District in Sierra Leone. She started this business in order to become self-reliant. 

She's been in this business for five years and sells cosmetics like hair dressings, creams, and slippers from her house. She also received income from her husband, who teaches as a profession. She says that her business is doing well. Her customer base has increased. Most of the young ladies in the area know her business. 

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more cosmetics like hair dressings, creams, slippers and human hair. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to educate her children. In the future, she would like to see her business increase. She is grateful for lenders' support.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics like hair dressings, creams, slippers and human hair.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children, and three of them go to school. She takes care of  additional family members (her mother, father and young sister). She operates a retail shop. She has been in business for the last five years. She works seven days a week. She also gets additional income from rental houses. 

Tessie has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy a jerrycan of cooking oil, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and 50 Kg of sugar. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to build rental houses and also to own a fully stocked  wholesale shop. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and a jerrycan of cooking oil

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. He is married and has four children ages 6, 9, 11 and 13. Wilfredo owns and operates a fishing business, and he also farms seaweed. He is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy lead weights, floaters and an engine for his fishing boat. Once these needed items are available, he will be more productive and more stable in his source of livelihood.

In the future, he hopes to improve and expand his business to increase his profits and investments for the sake of his family.

loans.use: to buy lead weights, floaters and an engine for his fishing boat

loans.name: Sreymao's Group

texts.en:
Sreymao, 27, is a villager in Cambodia. She is married and blessed with three children, two daughters and a son, all of whom are too young for school.

Sreymao and her husband earn their living by working for others. She earns around 16,000 KHR a day. After deducting her daily expenses, she finds she can only save 6,000 KHR.

Along with Somneang, her loan partner, Sreymao is seeking a 700,000 KHR loan. They are both first-time clients with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. With 400,000 KHR, her portion of the loan, Sreymao will work on building a house that will provide her family, especially her children, with a warm and healthy environment.

Sreymao’s ambition is to see her family’s living standards get better and better.

loans.use: To build a proper house.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es: Milagros, de 34 años es una mujer singular,. Vive en compañía de Alex, su esposo desde hace 8 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 3 años. Ella se adaptó al negocio de la familia de su esposo. La crianza de cerdos y la preparación de lechón (comida típica a base de carne de cerdo), es su principal actividad económica. Su trabajo consiste en la preparación de este sustancial plato, el cual realiza para por lo menos tres veces a la semana, ya que los vende en las fiestas que se realizan en todo el valle del Mantaro, gracias a ello conoce diversos pueblos y costumbres de los mismo. Gana muy bien en la preparación, pero cuenta que es muy cansado viajar y trasladar el enorme cerdo cocinado. Más ve recompensando, todo su esfuerzo, ya que muchos elogian su buena sazón. Pero en está época comienza la siembra por lo que Milagros comenzará a sembrar maíz en los terrenos agrícolas que heredó, está segura de tener mucho éxito. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “sicaya 2000” y este es el crédito número 11 con MFP, se siente feliz pues en este tiempo logró obtener muchas ganancias, todo gracias al apoyo económico que le brindan. Por ello promete cumplir con el pago de las cuotas. Además gusta de trabajar en su asociación, donde los integrantes son personas solidarias y trabajadoras. Milagros; invertirá el dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para la siembra de maíz “chulpe”, que se caracteriza por tener color amarillos y el restante lo invertirá en la mejora de el horno.
texts.en:
Milagros is a 34-year-old woman. She lives in the company of Alex, her spouse of 8 years. Together they have three children who they care for in their house which they bought three years ago. She has adapted to her husband's family's business which is their primary economic activity: the raising of pigs and the preparation of lechón (a typical Peruvian dish made of pork). Her work consists of the preparation of this substantial dish, which she does at least three times a week. They sell the lechón at parties throughout the Mantaro Valley. Thanks to this, they know many diverse towns and their customs. Preparation goes really well, but she says that it's very tiring to travel with and move an enormous cooked pig. But her her efforts are rewarded because many praise the good seasoning of the lechón. However right now it is planting season, so Milagros will begin to plant corn in the agricultural land that she inherited, and she is sure she will have much sucess. 

Milagros belongs to the communal bank Sicaya 2000. This will be loan number 11 for this group working with MFP. She feels happy because in this time she has achieved many gains thanks to the financial support they have provided her. For this reason she promises to comply with the repayment plan. What's more, she likes working in her association where all the women are supportive and hard-workers. 

Milagros will invest the money in the purchase of natural fertilizers for the planting of "chulpe" corn, which is characterized by its yellow colour. The rest will be invested in improving her oven.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers and fix her oven

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Chan is a 47-year-old mother of five children, only one of whom is dependent on her. Her family lives in a rural area of the Mongkoul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. To support her family, she has been engaged in raising three pigs and complementing her income by working for another person for a fee. The current business earns her about 25,000 KHR and allows her to save approximately 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. 

Chan has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles already. She successfully repaid the past loans which have helped to relieve her family’s burden and improve her livelihood. Now she is leading her group of four members to apply for a loan with VisionFund. Chan will use her portion to buy pig feed and five piglets for raising. She hopes this loan will enable her to fatten her pigs so as to sell them for a good price in order to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and five piglets to raise

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Eric

texts.fr: Célibataire de 29ans, Eric est un jeune électronicien et revendeur de CD, télévision et radio dans une boutique. Pour l’avancement de son activité, il est aidé par 02 personnes. Il sollicite de WAGES un prêt pour s’approvisionner en marchandises (CD, télévisions et radios). Il voudrait avec le profit agrandir sa boutique et aider ses parents.
texts.en:
Eric is a single 29-year-old man who resells electronics, CDs, TV sets and radios in a shop.  

Two people work with him and help him develop his business.  

He is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy more goods (CDs, TV sets and radios).  

He would like to use his profits to expand his shop and help his parents.

loans.use: to buy TV sets, radios and CDs.

loans.name: Chhour's Group

texts.en:
55-year-old Chhour is a villager in a rural area of Thmor Koul district, Battambang province, Cambodia. She is married and has seven children, four (one daughter, and three sons) of whom are employed as paid workers. To earn their living, Chhour and her husband work so many jobs. They work for others for a fee, plant corn and also cabbage. 

Chhour has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles already. The past loans have enabled her to buy corn seeds and meet her family’s needs. Now Chhour, accompanied by her fellow group member who is a first-time borrower with VisionFund, are seeking a loan in the amount of 200,000KHR each. Chhour will use her portion of the loan to buy more corn seeds and cabbage seeds. In the future, she dreams that her business (corn planting and cabbage planting) will provide her with higher crop yields so that she can increase her profit as well as improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: To buy more corn seeds and cabbage seeds

loans.name: Semny's Group

texts.en:
Semny, is a villager living in a rural area of Moung Russey in Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 24 years old, married and blessed with two children, both of whom are too young for school.

Semny and her husband earn their living by growing and selling rice. For the past several years they have also raised pigs. Each day Semny earns about 13,000 KHR. Her main challenge farming her paddy is drought.

Semny’s group consists of three members, all of whom are first-time borrowers with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. As leader of her group, she is applying for a 3,000,000 KHR loan to be split three ways. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and feed for her pigs.

With this loan Semny hopes to increase her crop’s yield. Greater productivity, and so increased profits will help her make life better for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Khan's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia, Khan is a 41-year-old married woman with three children. Two of her children, one daughter and one son, are still in school and dependent on her. To earn income for the family, Khan and her husband have been involved in rice farming for ten years, earning approximately 16,000KHR per day. 

Khan is leading a group of three women, all of whom are first-time borrowers with VisionFund, to take out a loan in the amount of 2,700,000KHR in total. With her very first loan portion, which is 700,000KHR, Khan will buy fertilizers and pesticides. She will also use a portion of it to spend on gasoline. In the future, she hopes that her business, which is rice farming, will provide her with better and higher crop yields so that she can sell it for more profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Yermi

texts.en:
Yermi (age 41) is married and blessed with a beautiful daughter named Ivanna (age 9), who is in the third grade of elementary school. Yermi is a hardworking and kind father. Yermi has been running a food stall that sells local food such as Nabas and RW, which are common foods in the area. The business is located in front of his house and close to the main road. He usually operates the business from 6 pm to 11 pm and gets between 15 and 25 customers in a day. 

Yermi realized that he could only improve the business by offering more menu items and beverages, but the limitation on business capital has prevented his dream. Yermi went to TLM to ask for a loan. He is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000, which he will use for buying business materials and equipment such as pork, a cooler box, a rice cooker, a juicer, and additional cooking ingredients. Yermi is optimistic that the loan from TLM will make a difference to his business.

loans.use: to buy items such as pork, a cooler box, a rice cooker, a juicer, and additional cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca, de 31 años de edad, es una mujer empeñosa y trabajadora, además de ser amable y cordial, es separada del padre de su hija de 8 años de edad.  Vive en compañía de su papá, mamá, su hija y sus 4 hermanos a los que quiere mucho, habitando la casa de sus padres. Las a actividad que realiza Blanca, es la venta de ropas y sandalias  de damas y caballeros,  para lo cual realiza viajes periódicos cada mes a la capital, donde realiza sus compras buscando los mejores precios y modelos ò en ocasiones le envía su tía quien vive en esa ciudad, para luego venderlos entre sus amistades de manera personal. También vende productos de belleza que comprar por catálogos, donde tiene bastante pedidos de sus amistades y familiares, realizando estos negocios desde hace 03 años realizándola ella sola.
Le gusta su negocio pues le genera ingresos económicos para solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de su hija, y los considera rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Antes tenia problemas económicos, pues se separó del padre de su hija,  y no recibía pensión para los gastos de su hija. Empezando a trabajar logrando tener muchas satisfacciones gracias a su negocio, tiene los deseos de ampliar su negocio y hacerlo crecer, abriendo una boutique en la casa de sus padres. Este será el préstamo número 05 con la institución MFP. Por ello cuenta con su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además de sentirse a gusto con banco comunal pues considera a  su grupo ser unido y solidario. Con el monto solicitado de 1800 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ropas y sandalias de diversos modelos y tallas, traídos de la capital,  buscando los precios más bajos y así tener mayores ganancias, ya que cuenta con pedidos por entregar.
texts.en:
Blanca is 31 years old, and is a very hardworking, earnest, polite and kind woman who has an eight-year-old daughter. Blanca lives with her parents, daughter and her four brothers, since she is separated from her husband. Blanca makes a living running a clothing sales business, and sells clothing and sandals for men, women and children. Every month, she makes a trip to the capital city to buy her merchandise and get the best deals and most stylish items. Every once in a while, her aunt will do the shopping for her, since she lives in the capital. Blanca sells her products to friends and contacts in her area, and she also sells beauty and cosmetic products from catalogs. She has been operating her business for three years now.

Blanca enjoys running her business, as it is going well and allows her to generate income to pay for her daughter's education, as well as household expenses.

In the past, Blanca has faced financial challenges, since she is separated from her husband, and he does not pay child support. As she has begun working and running her business, she has gained economic independence and satisfaction. She hopes to grow and strengthen her business, and to eventually open a boutique out of her parents' home. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she is grateful for the support she has received. She is glad to be a member of the community bank, as she feels it is a unified, supportive group. With the support from this loan, Blanca plans to invest in purchasing clothing and sandals in various styles, sizes and models, so that she can offer a wider variety to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and sandals.

loans.name: Thim's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Thim is 31 years old and married with two daughters; one is in school while the remaining one is too young for school. She has earned a living through farming rice on 5 hectares of farmland for five years and supplementing the income by selling clothes. She is able to earn from the current business approximately 30,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day and manages to save around 20,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Low crop yield that has been destroyed by drought is the main challenge for her rice paddy.

Thim’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for one loan cycle. She completely repaid the past loan, which has helped her to improve her living conditions. Now she and her group member are asking for a loan. Thim, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and will use a portion of it to spend on buying more clothes for selling. She hopes to increase her farming production to generate more income to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en: Yan is a 45-year-old married mother of five children. She lives in Moung Russey district located in Battambang province, Cambodia. Three of her children, two daughters and one son, are still dependent on her. Yan earns her living through farming rice and planting pineapple, the business in which she has been involved with for seven years. Yan received funding via VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, one cycle ago. With that loan she succeeded in securing her family’s finances. She now needs to buy fertilizers to apply in her rice and pineapple fields. Thus, she is leading a group member named Yat, who is a first-time borrower with VisionFund, to request a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. Yan will use the newly requested loan portion wisely in order to increase her crop yields, as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to apply in her rice and pineapple fields

loans.name: Kosal's Group

texts.en: Kosal is a resident residing in Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 30 years old, married, and blessed with four children. All of her kids, three daughters and one son, are dependent on her and still in school. Every day she sells cake in order to make a living, and her husband complements the income by farming rice. Kosal is leading a group member, Sokna, to request a loan in the amount of 300,000 KHR and 500,000 KHR, respectively. This will be their first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. With her portion of the loan, Kosal will buy fertilizers to support her husband’s business, which is rice farming. Via the use of this loan, she hopes that her income will be higher and her family’s living condition will be better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice farm

loans.name: Reina Etelvina

texts.es:
La joven Reina tiene 31 años de edad, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con ella vive su hijo y su esposo quien le ayuda y respalda en su actividad, su negocio es la venta de golosinas, actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años en su comunidad. Su negocio lo hace de manera ambulante ya que distribuye su producto en varias aldeas y caseríos aledaños al suyo.
Reina el crédito lo necesita para la compra de: carnes, aceite, plátano, banano verde, condimentos, harina de maíz, etc. el impacto esperado con el financiamiento, es que sus ventas se incrementen ya que comprara una buena cantidad de productos para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Reina los planes a futuro es seguir creciendo  día a día en su  actividad, como generarse buenos ingresos para tener  una mejor calidad de vida.
Choluteca, Honduras - Septiembre del 2012
texts.en:
Reina is 31 years old. She lives in the south of Honduras with her son and her husband, who helps her and supports her in her work. Her business is selling snacks, which she has been doing for three years now in her community. She works as a street vendor, and distributes her product in several towns and hamlets next to hers. Reina needs the loan to buy meat, oil, plantains, green bananas, condiments, cornmeal, etc. Hopefully, with this loan, her sales will increase, since she will buy a good quantity of products to meet her customers' needs. Her plan for the future is to grow day by day in her work, as well as earn a good income to have a better quality of life.

Choluteca, Honduras - September, 2012

loans.use: to buy meat, oil, plantains, green bananas, condiments, cornmeal, etc. for her business

loans.name: Clemente

texts.es:
Clemente tiene 45 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Lleva 3 años dedicándose a la compra y venta de ganado, lo aprendió por curiosidad, pues posee un camión y antes solo se dedicaba a transportar animales de otras personas. Para comprar y vender los animales viaja a los tiangues de diferentes ciudades del país durante toda la semana. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar más ganado. Así, podrá comprar más ganado, mejorar sus ganancias y su calidad de vida. Para tener suficiente capital propio y continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Clemente is 45 years old. He is married and has three children. For three years he has been buying and selling livestock. He learned this business out of curiosity, since he has a truck, and in the past he worked just transporting animals for other people. To buy and sell animals, he travels during the entire week to the small markets of the various cities of the country.

He will use the loan that he is applying for to buy more livestock. Thus, he will be able to buy more livestock and improve his earnings and his quality of life. He needs the loanl in order to have sufficient capital of his own and continue with his business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de son de riz (un aliment qui sert à nourrir les poules). Madame Ablavi a 58ans et mariée à un agent à la retraite. Ce quatrième prêt qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter des sacs de son de riz à l’intérieur du pays et de revendre à ceux qui élèvent les poules. Elle a démarré en 2008.
texts.en:
Ablavi is 58 years old, married to a retired officer, and she resells rice bran (which is used to feed poultry).  

It is the fourth time that she is requesting a loan, and she will use it to buy bags of rice bran within her country.  She will then resell her merchandise to poultry farmers.  

She started this activity in 2008.

loans.use: to buy rice bran.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,la socia tambien se dedica al negocio de cosmetologa,ella realiza ondulaciones,teñidos y cortes de cabello por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar los negocios de tienda de abarrotes y cosmetologia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar tintes,tijeras,liquidos para ondulacion y ruleros para implementar su negocio de cosmetologa.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This communal bank member continues her grocery store business. She sells basic products such as rice, sugar, milk, and crackers. She also has a cosmetology business. She does curling, coloring, and haircuts. Through these businesses, she is raising her children. Her dream is to expand her grocery and cosmetology businesses. She is applying for the loan to buy dyes, scissors, curling solutions, and rollers to supply her cosmetology business.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy dyes, scissors, curling solutions, and rollers to supply her cosmetology business

loans.name: Dora Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Dora tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, pero solo dos viven con ella uno de 18 años y el otro de 17 años respectivamente. Ella es propietaria de un molino de nixtamal y de una pequeña tienda instala en su casa; ya tiene varios años de poseer este negocio. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar los insumos para su tienda, la cual ella misma administra junto con sus hijos, pues ellos no estudian y actualmente están desempleados. Dora ve una gran oportunidad con la tienda, ya que los clientes que llegan al molino podrán comprar productos de primera necesidad allí mismo. Así obtendrá un ingreso extra, a parte de lo que gana su esposo como vigilante en una escuela. Además, mantendrá a sus hijos ocupados. Ella desea poseer un negocio bien solidó y contar con un patrimonio para su familia. Pues no viven en casa propia y su sueño es construir una propia.
texts.en:
Dora is 46 years old, married and has four children, but only two live with her; one 18 years old and the other 17. She is the owner of a corn mill and a small shop in her house and has owned this business for several years. 

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for her shop, which she runs with her children, as they do not study and are currently unemployed. Dora sees a great opportunity with the shop, as customers who go to the mill can buy essentials there. She can get extra income apart from what her husband earns as a school caretaker. As well, it will keep her children busy. She wants to have a good solid business and have equity for her family. She does not live in her own house and her dream is to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her shop.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de oca al horno,la oca es un tuberculo parecido a la papa,la socia vende en forma ambulatoria en el mercado,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio quiere sacra adelante a su hijo que estudia en el colegio,al socia ya tiene 3 años trabajando en este negocio y le va muy bien,en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta salir a pasear con su hijo,el sueño de la socia es poder tener un restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar ocas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This communal bank member continues with her business of selling roasted ocas. An oca is a tuber similar to a potato. She sells them as a street vendor in the market. She works from 8 am to 5 pm, and through this business she wants to raise her son, who is in primary school. She has already been working in this business for 3 years, and it is going very well for her. In her free time, she likes to go for walks with her son. Her dream is to have a restaurant. She is applying for the loan to buy ocas wholesale.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy ocas wholesale

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter, de 31 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su mamá Martha y sus 2 hermanos, a los que cuida en la casa de su mamá, donde habita desde que nació. Desde que su padre falleció, hace 22 años, sabía que su vida se centraría en el cuidado de su familia, mamá y hermanos. Por ello se mantiene soltero todavía, pues siempre fue un hombre responsable con las necesidades de su familia. Su principal ingreso económico se centra en el trasporte público con el motocarro que posee, ello le ayuda a obtener un ingreso diario, su ruta se centra en la entrada a su anexo y la ciudad, pero como él dice; también se dirige a diversos anexos, si le solicitan. “Todo es válido para poder obtener una mejor ganancia al terminar el día”, comenta. Es así que se dedica, también al cuidado de sus animales entre cerdos, ovejas y cuyes. Ya tiene 4 años dedicándose a esto, su secreto se centra en la alimentación, pues el mismo siembra pasto para dar de comer a sus animales. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, se siente feliz, pues tiene el capital necesario para mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida. Además le gusta pertenecer a su asociación, porque sus integrantes son personas solidarias y trabajadoras. Walter, invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago de la reparación y mantenimiento de la motocarro que posee.
texts.en: Walter is a 31 year old working man. He lives with his mother Martha and his two brothers, who look after his mother's house, where he has lived since he was born. Ever since his father passed away, 22 years ago, he knew that his life would be focused on taking care of his family, mother and brothers. Therefore, he remains single as he was always responsive to the needs of his family. His principle income is centered in public transportation with the motorcar he owns, because it helps him earn a daily income. His route focuses mainly on the entrance of his neighborhood and the city, but as he says, he will go to other neighborhoods if he is asked. "Anything goes to earn a better return at the end of the day," he comments. He also works caring for his animals; pigs, sheep and guinea pigs. He has been doing this for 4 years and his secret is centered on the food, as he grows the grass for the animals himself. This is his second loan with MFP, he is happy, as he has the necessary capital to improve his business and therefore his quality of life. In addition, he likes to belong to the association because the members are caring people and hard workers. Walter will invest the money he is requesting in the payment of the repair and maintenance of the motorcar her owns.

loans.use: to pay to for the repair and maintenance of the motorcar he owns.

loans.name: Rosa Nelly

texts.es: Rosa Nelly,  comenzó su negocio de venta de ropa de segunda en el 2007, siguiendo los mismos pasos de su mamá. Inició vendiendo 1 paca de ropa cada 3 meses con algunos vecinos y a medida que conocian su pequeño negocio, se incrementaban los pedidos. Hoy en día, la Sra. Rosa Nelly vende 3 pacas de ropa cada 3 meses y con el crédito solicitado piensa invertirlo para vender 5 pacas cada 3 meses, pues poco a poco se ha dado a conocer por la calidad de su inventario asi como lo puntual en el cumplimiento de sus compromisos.  Ella se siente muy contenta por el desarrollo de su negocio. Rosa Nelly junto con su mama Josefina manejan el negocio, además del apoyo de su esposo Eliseo, que es empleado de un centro médico. Ellos forman una familia con 2 hijos que estudian la primaria y el compromiso con ellos es darle una preparación en la vida y una carrera profesional. Ella es una mujer muy emprenderora y de mucho trabajo, nacida en la ciudad de Monterrey, México.
texts.en:
Rosa Nelly started her business selling second-hand clothing in 2007, following in her mother's footsteps. She started off selling one bundle of clothing every three months to some neighbors and as they got to know her small business, the orders increased. 

Nowadays, Rosa Nelly sells three bundles of clothing every three months, and intends to use the requested loan so that she can sell five bales every three months. Little by little she has made a name for herself because of the quality of her inventory, as well as for her punctuality in meeting her commitments.  She feels very happy about the development of her business. 

Rosa Nelly along with her mother, Josefina,  manage the business. This is in addition to the support from her husband, Eliseo, who is an employee in a health care center. They form a family with two children, who are in primary school. They are committed to providing them an education in life, and a professional career. 

She is a very enterprising and hard-working woman, born in the city of Monterrey, Mexico.

loans.use: To invest in merchandise in order to increase her sales and have better income.

loans.name: Koen's Group

texts.en:
Koen, 39, lives in a rural area in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has three dependent children, all still in school. The family's main source of income comes from rice farming on five hectares of farmland. Koen has been in this business for ten years and she is able to earn about 25,000 KHR per day, saving approximately 18,000 KHR daily after offsetting expenses. The main challenge facing Koen's paddy field business is low crop yield resulting from drought.

Koen’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. Koen is in her first loan cycle with VisionFund as she leads her group in applying for loans of 1,000,000 KHR and 500,000 KHR. Koen will use her portion of the loan mainly to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and set aside a small amount to buy gasoline. Koen hopes to get a high crop yield from the rice paddy in order to better her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Thoun

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Thoun is 33 and married with four children. All of her children are dependent on her, some are still in school and some work as paid workers in local area. To make a living, she has been catching fish for five years while her husband is a motorcycle-taxi driver to help the family generate the income. Together, they can earn approximately US$10 per day and manage to save about US$6 each day after offsetting daily expenses for the future needs.

Thoun received the first loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, a cycle ago. She successfully paid back the past loan which has helped her to better support the current business. Now she is requesting a loan of US $1,000. Thoun is going to use this loan to build on her saving in order to buy a decent motorcycle for her husband’s business. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a proper motorcycle for supporting her husband’s business so as to gain more income in order to make a living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorcycle for her husband’s business

loans.name: Hassanatu

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Hassanatu from Torkpoi town Southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with 5 children between the ages of 16 years and 26 years. She started this business when she went to a catering vocational for the poor.

Hassanatu runs a catering food snack around her local area, she sells rice bread, ginger beer and cake. She has been running this business for 8 years. She wakes up at 6:00 am to start preparing her baked food snacks and she does not rest until the food is sold. She also earns income from her elder children's monthly support. 

Hassanatu has requested a loan in order to buy oil and more bags of flour, sugar, and rice. The extra income from this loan will allow her pay her installment, have lunch, and help her domestic expenses. In the future, she plans to open a bakery. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy oil and more bags of flour, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 39 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y emprendedora.  Es conviviente con Juan quien se dedica al transporte, vive con su pareja y sus dos  menores hijos de 14 y 8 años de edad, por los cuales se esfuerza en salir adelante,  tiene su casa propia la cual compró con el apoyo de su pareja. El trabajo de Elizabeth consiste en la venta de plátanos y pescados frescos, la cual está implementada en un espacio muy bien acondicionado en el frontis de su casa, donde atiende en las mañanas muy amablemente a sus clientes desde muy temprano. Trabaja todos los días sin cesar desde hace 8 años con el dinero que tenía ahorrado gracias a trabajos eventuales que realizaba. Realiza su función sola y con mucho entusiasmo. Afortunadamente le va muy bien por que diariamente logra vender todos los productos que ofrece a la venta. Le gusta su trabajo porque le permite tener un ingreso económico y le da la tranquilidad que necesita para poder brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos, le gusta socializarse, ella sigue esforzándose  gracias a que su puesto es muy concurrido. Por tanto tiene muchas ganas de ampliar su negocio mejorando la infraestructura de su pequeño puesto, además quiere comprar un motocarro para alquilarlo y generarse más ganancias. Este es el crédito número 5 con MFP, agradece a quienes le brindan la oportunidad para acceder a este crédito financiero que le brinda la seguridad para continuar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual ya que no desea dejar una imagen negativa en los miembros de su grupo que se caracterizan por la puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos. Con el préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará racimos de plátano para continuar vendiendo y otra parte lo invertirá en la compra de pescado fresco como palometa y bagre.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 39 years old, is a happy and entrepreneurial woman. She lives with Juan who works in transportation. She lives with her life partner and two minor children who are 14 and 8 years old, for whom she strives to get ahead. She was able to purchase her own home with the help of her life partner. 

Elizabeth sells bananas and fresh fish. She remodeled the front part of her house to be a store. She starts working very early treating her clientele kindly. She has been working every day without closing for 8 years. She has money saved thanks to temporary work. She worked for herself very enthusiastically.  

Fortunately, she does well because she manages to sell all the products she has for sale on a daily basis.  She likes her job because it gives her steady income and the peace of mind that she needs to offer the most to her children. 

She likes to socialize. She keeps working hard because her store is well attended. She is very motivated to grow her business by improving the infrastructure of the small shop. She also wants to buy a small car to lease it and generate more income. 

This is her fifth loan and she is grateful to those who have given her the opportunity to get the credit that gives her the security to continue to work. She commits one more time to faithfully and punctually repay the loan since she does not want to leave a bad impression with her group that are characterized by punctuality and responsibility in their payments. 

With the loan of 1000 soles she will buy bunches of bananas to continue to sell. The other part she will invest in the purchase of fresh fish such as palometa and catfish.

loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en:
Nanuli, aged 47, is from a small village in the Khashuri district. She lives with her husband and two grown children. Her daughter works in the local factory and earns a monthly salary. Nanuli’s husband is a tractor driver who serves the local farmers for a service fee. The family runs an animal husbandry business with several pigs and 3 milk cows. Nanuli produces cheese, which is sold to cheese retailers. The family also grows different kinds of vegetables such as onions, haricots and potatoes on their land. Part of the harvested produce is sold at the local open market and the rest is used for family needs. Nanuli works hard but the family still doesn’t have enough income to acquire some savings and improve their living conditions.

Nanuli has requested a loan to repair and expand the sheds for the pigs and cows. The existing sheds are already too small and don’t allow Nanuli to plan future expansion of the family’s farming activities. She will purchase construction materials for the new sheds. After the buildings are expanded, Nanuli will be able to increase the number of her cattle and her dairy production and get more pork. This will increase the family's income, which will allow Nanuli to renovate her house and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair and expand the pig and cow sheds

loans.name: Yunari

texts.en:
Yunari is a 32 year old lady. She lives with her mother and her only daughter Putri, aged 3 years old. As the breadwinner for her family, Yunari works hard to fulfill the family's needs.

Since graduating from a local vocational school several years ago, Yunari has initiated a tailoring business at home. Generally, Yunari sews women's clothing such as blouses, skirts, trousers, Kebaya (women's traditional clothes), and office uniforms. It takes 2 to 3 days to produce a set of clothes and 2 days for top or bottom wear. She doesn't have a buttonhole-sewing machine, which has slowed down her production.

She comes to TLM and requests a loan of 5,000,000 IDR to purchase the buttonhole-sewing machine and other materials such as fabric and sewing threads. By having these things, she she will be able to complete orders quicker and generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase a buttonhole machine and other materials such as fabric and sewing threads.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 26 years old and live in Buchanan. She is married and has four children between the ages of 2 and 16. For the past six years she has been frying chicken and cala (local doughnut) for sale in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, flour, and sugar for her business. She hopes to become an international businesswoman in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, flour and sugar for her business

loans.name: Al-Wafa Group

texts.en:
Al-Wafa is a group which consists of four women who live in Sana`a, Yemen.

Hana a 45-year-old, single woman and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. Her educational background is diploma-level. She has a house for which she wants to buy home appliances. She is requesting a loan of 50000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a washing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine for her house

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”, la socia continua con su negocio de cabinas de internet, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez continua con su negocio de call center trabajando desde las 06:00am hasta la 01:00pm y por la tarde se encarga de atender su negocio de internet, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento a un par de computadoras.
La socia sale en la foto con una de sus hijas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the “Madres Trabajadores" communal bank. She is continuing with her Internet café business. She has been in this business for some time, and it is going well, thanks to the effort she puts into it each day. 

At the same time, she is continuing with her call center business, working from 6:00am until 1:00pm; in the afternoon, she looks after running her Internet business. The borrower is a responsible and hard-working person, as this how she is helping her family get ahead in life. 

She is requesting the loan in order to carry out maintenance on a pair of computers. 

The borrower is shown in the photo, with one of her daughters. 

She feels grateful for the loan granted, and promises to make her scheduled instalment payments.

loans.use: To carry out maintenance on a pair of computers.

loans.name: Seham Group

texts.en:
This group, called Seham, consists of five female members. They are from Hodeida, Yemen and they know each other very well. All the group members are considered hardworking people who very much want to get ahead. This group took a loan of 210,000 YER from AMB.

Gabool is a 44-year-old single woman who is happy to be a part of this group. She has been distributing ladies' clothes, perfumes and incense. Gabool started the business with a small amount to earn more profit. She loves her work and hopes to continue. Her portion of this group loan is 50,000 YER, which she will use to continue buying fabrics, perfumes and incense.

loans.use: to continue buying fabrics, perfumes and incense for resale

loans.name: Sophorn's Group

texts.en:
Sophorn is a villager from a rural area of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. She is a 25-year-old mother of two dependent children, one of whom is in school while the other is too young for school. To support the family, Sophorn has been farming rice on 4.5 hectares of farmland for five years. She is able to earn about KHR 24,000 per day and to save about KHR 6,000 daily after expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her rice paddy. 

Sophorn is a first-cycle client and the other group member is a second-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Sophorn and her group member are requesting a new loan with VisionFund of KHR 1,000,000 each. Sophorn will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her cultivated land and to pay labor fees. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and timely so as to better her living status and to keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her cultivated land

loans.name: Monica Jaqueline

texts.es: Monica de 22 años es soltera y se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Contabilidad y Finanzas en la Universidad de las Américas. Por convalidación, la carrera dura 2 años y medio (5 ciclos) y aun le falta 1 año y medio (3 ciclos) para culminar. Ella trabaja como auxiliar contable en una empresa de Asesoría Contable, generando ingresos el cual lo destina a pagar sus estudios. Ella está muy inspirada y motivada en terminar su carrera, ya que son sus padres quienes le dan la fuerza para poder salir adelante. Uno de sus mayores desafíos es el poder estudiar y trabajar a la misma vez, es por eso que le pone mucho entusiasmo y dedicación a lo que estudia. Su plan para el futuro es convertirse en una contadora  de éxito y convertirse en una profesional independiente.
texts.en:
Monica, who is 22 years old, is single and studying Accounting and Finance at Universidad de las Américas (University of the Americas). To graduate, the major takes two-and-a-half years (5 cycles) and she has a year-and-a-half left (3 cycles) to finish. 

She works as an assistant accountant in “Asesoria Contable” (Accounting Firm). Her income is used to pay her tuition. She is very motivated to graduate because her parents give her the inspiration to get ahead. 

One of her biggest challenges is to work and study simultaneously. For this reason she is very enthusiastic and dedicated to her studies. Her plan for the future is to become a successful accountant and independent professional.

loans.use: to pay tuition

loans.name: Yudaya

texts.en:
Yudaya lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She sells green bananas at the market on retail basis. She has been in business for the last 6 years. She also earns additional income from roasting maize. She works six days a week.

She has requested for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenge is transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are own a delivery van and to build a house. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en:
Thea, 30 years old, is a farmer living in a rural area in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has two dependent daughters; one is in school while the other is too young for school. To make a living, Thea has been farming rice on 4 hectares of farmland for five years. The current business earns her about 20,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 14,000 KHR daily after expenses. 

Thea and her group member are seeking their first loan with VisionFund of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Thea will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her cultivated land and to pay for gasoline in plowing the field. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and fruitfully so as to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her cultivated land

loans.name: Juan Ignacio

texts.es: JUAN TIENE 38 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES UN HOMBRE CASADO. EL TIENE UN NEGOCIO PROPIO, UBICADO EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO. DESDE HACE 8 AÑOS EL Y SU ESPOSA ATIENDEN EL NEGOCIO EL CUAL TIENEN COMO SU UNICA FUENTE DE INGRESOS. JUAN DESEA PODER HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO DE TIENDA DE ABARROTES, EL CUAL LE HA DADO BUENOS RESULTADOS Y LE HA PERMITIDO CUBRIR CON SUS NECESIADES FAMILIARES. ACTUALMENTE EL VE LA POSIBILIDAD DE HACERLO CREECER, INVIRTIENDOLE EN LA COMPRA DE MAS PRODUCTO CON LO CUAL EL PUEDA TENER SU NEGOCIO BIEN SURTIDO Y CON MAS VARIEDAD PARA SUS CLIENTES. POR ESTE MOTIVO EL HA SOLICITADO EL PRESTAMO PARA LLEVAR ACABO UNA MAYOR INVERSION EN SU NEGOCIO Y LE PERMITA HACERLO CREECER PARA AUMENTAR SUS GANANCIAS Y ASI PODER OFRECER UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA A SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Juan is 38 years old and married. He has his own business located in his house. For eight years he and his wife have run the business, which is their only source of income. 

Juan would like to be able to make his grocery shop business grow. So far the business has been successful and has allowed him to cover his household expenses. He now sees the potential to make it grow, by investing in the purchase of more merchandise to ensure his shop is well-stocked and has more variety for his customers. 

For this reason he is asking for a loan to make a big investment in his business which will allow him to make it grow, so that he can increase his income and in this way offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Emprendedoras Del Valle El Triunfo Group

texts.es: Saludos desde Perú,  voy a presentarles  a un grupo conformado por 5 mujeres luchadoras y  con gran iniciativa para los negocios, así se caracteriza el grupo comunal “emprendedoras del valle  el triunfo”. Una de  ella es la Sra. Gumercinda de 41 años de edad casada y madre de 3 hijos, el cual son su  motivo de desarrollo de todos los días, la Sra. Gumercinda desde muy temprano  se dedica a la venta de hierbas naturales en distintos mercados de la zona por donde vive y posterior a eso se dedica a la venta de comida. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en compras de utensilios de cocina (ollas y cucharones). La Sra. Gumercinda está muy contenta  por el préstamo otorgado y agrádese  el interés brindado y la confianza que han depositado en ella, deja la promesa de seguir superándose para mejorar la calidad de vida  de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Greetings from Peru!  Allow me to introduce you to a group of 5 tenacious women who have shown great initiative in their businesses.  Their communal bank is called “Businesswomen from Valle El Triunfo”.  One of the members is Gumercinda, who is 41 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children; they are her reason for making progress every day.  Gumercinda makes a living selling natural herbs in different markets in the area where she lives, starting very early in the morning.  She also makes a living selling food, which she does later in the day.  She will use this loan to purchase cooking utensils (pots and ladles).  Gumercinda is very happy about the loan, the interest that has been offered, and the confidence that has been placed in her.  She promises to keep improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase cooking utensils (pots and ladles).

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es: EL SEÑOR DEMETRIO,  VIVE EN LA COMUNIDAD DE  YUNGUILLAS DE LA  PROVINCIA DE MIZQUE DEL DEPARTAMENTO DE COCHABAMBA,  TIENE UN HIJO, DEMETRIO SE DEDICA A TRABAJAR EN LA AGRICULTURA, EN LA ANTERIOR COSECHA HUBO  DESASTRE NATURAL DE HELADA  Y SUS CULTIVOS BAJARON DE RENDIMIENTO, ESTE DESASTRE LE HIZO FRACASAR EN SUS INGRESOS ECONÓMICOS QUE SE MANTENÍAN CON LA PRODUCCIÓN AGRÍCOLA. CADA AÑO PRODUCEN CEBOLLA, ARVEJA   EN SU PEQUEÑA PARCELA. DEMETRIO ES UNA PERSONA  MUY QUERIDA Y RESPETADA EN EL LUGAR DONDE VIVE, POR LO DEDICADO A SU HIJO  Y SU TRABAJO QUE A VECES HASTA TIENE QUE TRABAJAR EN JORNAL EN LA AGRICULTURA PARA GANAR ALGUNOS PESOS Y ASÍ MANTENER A SUS PEQUEÑO HIJO, EL  ESTÁ SOLICITANDO EL CRÉDITO PARA COMPRAR MAS SEMILLA DE ARVEJA, SEMILLA DE FREJOL Y ABONO ORGANICO Y DE ESTA FORMA MEJORARA LA CALIDAD Y EL RENDIMIENTO DE SUS CULTIVOS, QUE TRABAJA EN SU PEQUEÑA PARCELA QUE TIENE EN EL LUGAR DONDE VIVE  PARA MEJORAR SUS INGRESO ECONÓMICO Y  DARLE UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA A SU HIJO Y QUE EL  PUEDA ASISTIR A LA ESCUELA  EN MEJORES CONDICIONES.  EL CRÉDITO AYUDARA MUCHO A SU HIJO Y A EL.
texts.en:
Demetrio lives in the community Yunguillas, the province of Mizque , in the department of Cochabamba.  He has a son. Demetrio is a farmer. During the last harvest there was a natural disaster.  The crops froze and decimated his output. This disaster caused him to lose his income because he supports himself through the harvest production. Every year he produces onions and peas in his small parcel of land. 

Demetrio is a well-loved and respected person in the community where he lives. He is so dedicated to his child and work that he has to do side jobs in agriculture to earn some money to support his small son. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase seeds for peas, seeds for beans, and organic fertilizer. This way he will improve the quality and performance of his crops. He works in a little parcel of land that he owns by his house so he can improve his income and give a better life to his son so he can attend school. The loan would significantly help him and his son.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for peas, beans, and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, de 33 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante.  Está casada con Marco quien es padre de sus 2 hijos Vivian de 14 y Marco de 7 años de edad respectivamente. Junto a ellos habita cómodamente su propia casa que logró comprar con su pareja. La actividad que realiza Elizabeth es la venta de gaseosas, cervezas, hielo y jugos envasados, también pone a la venta productos de belleza que ofrece por catálogo y los vende entre sus amistades, familiares y otros clientes eventuales. Muchas veces vende al contado y otras al crédito, hasta el momento ha tenido buenos resultados y conoce muchas personas. Realiza este trabajo desde hace 4 años y lo hace sola. También cuenta con 2 mototaxis los cuales pudo comprarlos con cierto apoyo crediticio, ambos los alquila diariamente por lo cual recibe un pago fijo. Eventualmente vende comida en la vereda de su casa durante los fines de semana.  Le agrada realizar sus negocios pues puede manejar su tiempo libre para atender a sus pequeños hijos a quienes quiere mucho y son su motivación para salir adelante, además se siente feliz por los ingresos económicos que le genera su trabajo con los cuales puede apoyar a su pareja a pagar los gastos de su hogar. Le incomoda cuando sus clientes se retrasan en el pago de sus créditos, pero eso no la desanima. Por tanto tiene planes de seguir trabajando ya que se siente bien y conforme con sus actividades, pues le da la independencia que ella necesita. Este es el préstamo número 13 con la institución MFP, por ello agradece a las personas que hacen posible su crédito y le dan la oportunidad de continuar trabajando para lograr sus objetivos, está comprometida al pago puntual de sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. 
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles refaccionará uno de sus mototaxis para que funciones adecuadamente, también comprará un nuevo stock de cosméticos conformado por perfumes, shampoo, acondicionador, talco, lápiz labial, cremas corporales entre otros.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 33, and a hard-working, determined woman with a great desire to succeed. She is married to Marco, who is the father of her two children, Vivian, 14 and Marco, 7. She lives comfortably with them in her own home, which she and her partner managed to buy. 

The work Elizabeth does is selling soft drinks, beer, ice, and bottled juices. She also sells beauty products that she offers through a catalog, and sells them among her friends, family members, and to other occasional customers. Many times she sells for cash, and other times on credit. 

Up to now, she has has good results and knows many people. She has been doing this work for four years and does it on her own. She also has two mototaxis, that she was able to buy with some loan assistance. She rents out both on a daily basis, for which she receives a fixed payment. 

Occasionally, she sells food on the sidewalk in front of her home during the weekend.  She likes carrying on her businesses,as she can manage her free time to look after her small children, whom she loves very much and who are her motivation for success. In addition, she feels happy about the income her business generates, and with which she is able to help her partner pay the household expenses. 

It bothers her when her customers are behind in paying their credit, but that does not discourage her. Therefore, she has plans to continue working; as she feels good, and is satisfied with her activities, as they give her the independence she needs. 

This is her 13th loan with the MFP institution, so she is grateful to the people who make her loan possible and give her the opportunity to continue working to achieve her objectives. She promises to pay her installments on time and very responsibly. 

With the requested amount of 1000 nuevos soles, she will repair one of her mototaxis so that it runs properly. She will also buy a new stock of cosmetics, including perfumes, shampoo, conditioner, powder, lipstick, body creams and other products.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, shampoo, conditioner, powder, lipstick, body creams and other products.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es: La señora Asunta tiene 41 años está casada con el señora Sergio Alba, tienen tres hijos los cuales estudian en una  escuelita de la misma zona donde viven,  la señora Asunta ha sufrido mucho de niña ya que el padre los abandono a  ella y a su madre, y la madre sola ha logro sacarle adelante y ahora la señora Asunta es quien se hace cargo de la madre y le cuida muchísimo. La señora Asunta y su familia viven en la comunidad de la Maica de la ciudad de Cochabamba, gracias a su trabajo y con la ayuda del esposo tienen una casa donde pueden vivir, la principal actividad es la producción de la leche cruda, el producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos y el esposo se dedica a prestar servicios de mecánica. El destino del crédito es para la construcción de un galpón para alojar el ganado, ya que en la temporada de lluvia sufren los ganados, esto le servirá mucho para la comodidad y el mejor cuidad de su ganado. Es el tercer crédito Kiva que se le está otorgando y la señora Asunta declara que está muy contenta ya que le ayudo mucho en su en la realización de su actividad. Entre sus sueños y metas esta seguir cuidando a su madre hasta la hora de su muerte y que sus hijos estudien una carrera profesional para que de esa manera puedan tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Asunta is 41 years old and is married to Sergio Alba. They have three children who are studying in a school in the same area where they live. Asunta has suffered a lot as a child; her father abandoned her and her mother, and her single-mother managed to get them ahead. Now Asunta is the one who takes care of her mother and she cares for her very much. Asunta and her family live in the community of Maica in the city of Cochabamba. Thanks to her work and her husband’s help they have a house where they can live. The main business is the production of raw milk. The product is delivered to a company that produces dairy products and her husband provides mechanical services.

The loan is to build a shed to house livestock because in the rainy season the cattle suffer a lot. This will help them a lot with the comfort and the best care of the livestock. This is the third Kiva loan being given and Asunta says she is very happy as this helps a lot in conducting her business. Among her dreams and goals is to continue taking care of her mother until the time of her death and that her children study for a career so that they can have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to build a shed for her cows.

loans.name: Venice

texts.en:
Venice, 31, is from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with five children, ranging in age from 8 months to 13.

She has been in the fishing business for 10 years working alongside her husband to support their family. The business is doing well. She only encounters challenges when the weather is not suitable for fishing. 

Right now, Venice is requesting a loan to buy fishing net, nylon and rope that's needed for daily fishing. She hopes that with these ready, she and her husband will be more productive. 

Venice hopes she can expand her ventures and earn as much as she can so that she will be able to save and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, nylon and rope.

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Arif is a 30-year-old woman who is married to Metusalah, a 39-year-old man. They are blessed with three daughters: Valensia, 8, is in the third grade of elementary school; Gresia, 6, is in the first grade of elementary school; and Kiki, 3, who is not yet attending school. 

In order to better meet her family's needs, Arif started a food stall business last year. She provides meals such as fried chicken, spicy fish, fried fish, soy bean cake, tofu and cassava leaves in the stall. 

Currently, she has four employees who assist her in serving the customers, washing dishes, etc. Arif dreams of enlarging her business by providing more chairs, tables and kitchen equipment. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from TLM of 6000000 IDR to purchase those things.

loans.use: to purchase more chairs, tables and kitchen equipment.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is from a small village in the Kareli district. She is 25 years old, widowed and lives with her parents, sister and two children (7 and 9 years old). Nana’s children get an orphan pension from the local government. They go to the local school. 

The family runs an animal husbandry business with a calf and a milk cow (whose milk is used for dairy production). Nana produces cheese, which is sold locally. In addition, they grow different kinds of cereals on a family-owned land. Nana is very hard-working woman with a great desire to get ahead.

Nana requested a loan to rent land. Nana will cultivate the land and sow more cereals. The family will do all the relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. The harvested production will be sold and this will significantly increase the income of the family. 

With the increased income Nana will improve the living conditions of her family and finance the education of her orphaned children. She awaits your help and kindness.

loans.use: to rent and cultivate agricultural land.

loans.name: Housam

texts.en:
Housam is a 31-year-old married man and father of one child. He has been selling mobile phones since 2011. He worked hard to improve his business and increase his available collection to make sure that all his customers' needs are met.

Housam is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua for the second time. He wants to buy a car to visit wholesale dealers in addition to his family's requests.

Housam's previous loan was used to increase his business capital, which helped a lot in improving his income. 

Housam's customers enjoy dealing with him because he has everything they need (mobiles, accessories and maintenance) in addition to prepaid mobile cards.

loans.use: to buy a car that will help him visit wholesale dealers.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is a 35-year-old married woman with two children ages 5 and 7. She and her family live in Cabawan District, Tagbilaran City. Paz is engaged in selling home-cooked dishes out of vegetables and meat. She is happy that she has the means to help her husband who works as a laborer. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables and seasoning. 

With her current number of customers, she knows that more variety of menu will help attract more to her services. Paz is hopeful that, through perseverance and hard work, she can improve her business and earn more for the needs of her children, which is her priority. In addition to this, she wants to continually send her children to school and do some reinvesting.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables and seasoning.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Ms. Shamim is a 43-year-old housewife. Her husband has been doing a business of tailoring for many years. The man shown in the photo is Shamim’s husband. He set up his own business four years ago; he makes menswear like shirts, sherwanies (formal wedding dress), dress pants and every type of uniform, etc. He always works hard to support his family. 

Shamim with her family lives in a small village of Faisalabad. She has four children. She requested a loan of amount 30,000 Pakistan rupees (Rs) for her husband’s business growth. In this way, he would be able to purchase raw materials such as threads, fabric, needles, buttons and other relevant accessories that ultimately help in providing better services to his customers without delay. He hopes to earn more income that he wishes to utilize on his family's well-being and for the expansion of his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials such as threads, fabric, needles, buttons and other relevant accessories.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 32 years old and lives in Buchanan. She’s single and has three children between 2 and 12 years old who live at home and are in school. For the past eight years she has been operating a cook shop (restaurant) where she sells delicious Liberian food. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, fish, etc., for her business. She hopes to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, fish, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Flor Angela

texts.es:
Flor trabajó durante 25 años en la actividad de la confección, y luego se retiró de la empresa donde trabajó porque ya no contaba con las fuerzas para ir hasta la empresa todos los días. Por eso fue que decidió montar su taller de confección en la casa con unos pequeños ahorros y esforzarse mucho para sacarlo adelante. Hasta el momento ha podido ir superando sus dificultades de capital, pero como en el momento no tiene el dinero suficiente para una máquina, Flor está en busca de un préstamo para comprar una máquina recubridora para poder tener una confección de mejor calidad. 

Su sueño es poder tener una mejor calidad de vida y también terminar de construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Flor worked as a seamstress for 25 years. She retired from the company where she worked because she did not have the strength to travel to her job each day. For this reason, she decided to establish a sewing workshop in her home with some savings and has worked hard to move her business forward. So far Flor has been able to overcome difficulties with capital, but now she does not have sufficient funds to buy a piece of equipment.

Flor is requesting a loan in order to buy a cover-stitch machine so that she can produce items of better quality. Her dreams are to have a better quality of life and to finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy a cover-stitch machine.

loans.name: Primero Dios Group

texts.es:
Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedoras con éxitos, don Dámaso  Abba de 56 años el cual se dedica a la comercialización de maíz, frijoles y cultiva estos productos, esta actividad la viene iniciando desde hace 10 años.
El crédito lo utilizara en el acopio de maíz, frijoles, y la compra de insumos como fertilizantes, abonos para la cosechas
texts.en:
This group is formed by three successful entrepreneurial partners. Damaso Abba is 56 and sells corn, beans and also grows these crops, he has done this activity for 10 years.
The loan will be used to buy corn, beans and to buy post harvest fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans and to buy post harvest fertilizer.

loans.name: Kholniso

texts.ru: Холнисо очень трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 44 года, замужем и на воспитании имеет 4  детей. Она имеет более чем 16 лет опыта в бизнесе. Она занимается куплей продажей рыбы. Она продает рыбу на местном рынке. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для того, чтобы купить рыбу для продажи. Она надеется на вас и на вашу доброту.
texts.en: Kholniso is a very hard-working woman. She is 44 years old, married and bringing up for children. She has over 16 years of experience in this business. She buys fish for resale. She sells her fish at the local market. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 TJS in order to buy fish for resale. She is counting on you and your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es: Ricardina de 50 años de edad, vive en Cochabamba es divorciada de lo cual tiene 5 hijos que 4 dependen de ella, estudio hasta el nivel primario es una persona humilde y trabajadora ella se dedica  a la venta de comida desde tempranas horas se levanta para poder cocinar para poder vender en su negocio le ayudan sus hijos en lo que puedan ya que sus hijos estudia en la Universidad Ricardina  se hace cargo ya que su ex esposo no le ayuda con los gastos familiares, su hijo el mayor le ayuda con algunos gastos que se pueda. El presente crédito que solicita Ricardina es para la compra muebles y mercaderia de comida ya que no tiene capital y necesita para poder ampliar un poco mas su negocio de comida y poder generar un poco mas de sus ingresos y para poder seguir pagando sus estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ricardina is 50 years old and lives in Cochabamba. She is divorced and has five children, four of whom are dependent on her. Ricardina studied through elementary school and is a modest and hardworking individual. She earns her living by selling food.

During the early morning hours, Ricardina wakes up so that she can begin cooking for her business. Her children help her whenever they can since they are studying at the university. Ricardina took charge since her ex-husband does not help with the family expenses. Her oldest son helps with some of the expenses that he is able to pay.

The current loan Ricardina is requesting will be used to buy furniture and food supplies since she does not have the capital. She needs to expand her business a bit more in order to generate some more income so that she can continue paying for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy furniture and supplies for her food stand.

loans.name: Ramos

texts.es: Aunque por muchos años Ramos ha tenido una relación muy estrecha con el cultivo de café fue hasta hace 5 años que se comenzó a dedicar a producirlo debido a un terreno que le fue heredado por su padre y su tio. Ramos combina sus labores de cafeticultor con su trabajo en el área de logística en un beneficio de café y para que esto sea posible él contrata a jornaleros que se encargan de ayudarlo a realizar las labores propias del campo y de esta manera también ayuda a la economía familiar de las personas que contrata. La producción anual de Ramos actualmente es de 2.5 toneladas pero sabe que con la extensión de terreno que cuenta es suficiente para llegar a producir hasta 4 toneladas anuales y por eso ha renovado mucha de su planta para que en un lapso de 3 años pueda alcanzar su meta. Él necesita comprar fertilizante y hacer labores de limpieza y conservación de sus parcelas y para eso necesita de un crédito. Ramos quiere hacer que sus fincas produzcan más para que en el futuro se las pueda dejar a sus hijos para que ellos las trabajen.
texts.en:
Although for many years Ramos has had a very close relationship with coffee growing, it was only five years ago that he began to produce it, due to a piece of land he inherited from his father and uncle.

Ramos combines his work as a coffee grower with his job in logistics for a coffee processing plant. To make this possible, he hires day laborers who are responsible for helping him to carry out the farm work; this way he also helps the family finances of the people he hires. 

Ramos' annual production is 2.5 tons, but he knows that with the area of land he has, there is enough to achieve an output of up to 4 tons annually. That is why he has greatly renewed his plantation, so that within a period of three years, he can reach his goal. 

He needs to buy fertilizer and do clearing and maintenance work on his parcels of land, and that is why he needs a loan. Ramos wants to have his parcels  produce more, so that in the future he can leave them to his children, so that they can work them.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and clear his parcels of land.

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es:
