Doña María Lourdes microempresaria de éxitos que tiene una pulpería desde hace 19 años  en su domicilio. Ella lleva varios créditos con la institución y le han servido para mejorar y ampliar su negocio
Este crédito lo utilizara para compra de arroz, aceite, azúcar, pollo, frijoles etc. con el propósito de seguir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Lourdes is a successful micro-entrepreneur that's had a convenience store at home for 19 years.  She's had several loans with the institution that have helped her improve and expand her business.
This loan will be used to buy rice, oil, sugar, chicken, beans etc with the purpose to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to by rice, beans, sugar, oil, dog food, chicken, beef.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is 44 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa, located in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has 8 children, 4 of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Ben has been working hard to manage his clothing store, where he sells items such as dresses, suits and shoes. 

To help expand his business, Ben has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. This loan will be used to buy more clothes, suits, sandals and caps. This increased inventory will bring in more customers, which will help Ben to generate greater profits. Ben hopes that he will be able to become a wholesaler in the future. 

Ben is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). This program primarily serves small-business entrepreneurs like Ben who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but who own businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, suits, sandals and caps

loans.name: Mowafak

texts.en:
Mowafak is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, married and has two children. He is the only provider for the family.

Mowafak owns a small library. He specializes in photocopying. He established his business in 2007, and he has now one employee and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to buy a generator and make signage for the shop. He also wants to pay the annual rent for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator and make signage for the shop. He also wants to pay the annual rent for the shop.

loans.name: Bindu

texts.en: Bindu is 49 years old and lives in Buchanan. She’s married to a businessman and has three children between the ages of  12 and 23. They are attending school and live at home. For the past 13 years, Bindu has been selling used clothes. She enjoys the buying, because she makes a lot of profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes to resell. She hopes to build a house for her children and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Luz Benigna

texts.es:
Doña Luz microempresaria de éxito y emprendedora es dueña de una pulpería ,vende leña y ropa nueva desde hace 4 años, lleva varios préstamos y estos le han ayudado a que su negocio vaya creciendo y diversificando sus productos para ofrecerles mejor a sus clientes.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa y productos de pulperías como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, golosinas etc.
texts.en:
Luz is a successful micro-entrepreneur that has owned a convenience store for four years, she sells fire wood and new clothing, she's had several loans that have helped grow and diversify the business and the products offered to better serve her clients.
The loan will be invested in the purchase of clothing and store products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, snacks, etc.

loans.use: to buy varied new clothing and products such as basic grains like rice and beans, sugar, detergent, soap.

loans.name: Weyatta

texts.en:
Weyatta is 45 years old and married with three children, ages 14 to 25. She runs a local food stand business in Kandehtown Southern area Bo District in Sierra Leone. As a housewife, she started this business to raise income to take care of the home.

She's been in this business for 10 years and sells rice, palm oil, gari and groundnut at the market area. Her business is the only income she has. She describes her main problem as low purchasing power of customers. 

Weyatta requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase rice, palm oil, gari, and groundnut. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to educate her Children. In the future, she would like to improve her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, palm oil, gari, and groundnut.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 43 years old, married and lives in Buchanan. She completed her education at grade 12. For the past 10 years, she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She established this business with small loans from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Ekram

texts.en:
Ekram is a 56-year-old married woman and mother of two children. Since 2005, she has operated a convenience store selling beverages, sweets and many other requested goods, in addition to selling clothes.
In the beginning, Ekram faced slight difficulties since her customers are only her area neighbors which limits her expansion.
Ekram applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her business capital by increasing her store inventory with special offer products in addition to selling a special autumn clothes collection. She hopes that through this loan, she will be capable of improving her business which will increase her income and improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to increase her business capital by increasing her store inventory with special offer products, in addition to offering a special autumn clothes collection.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en: Flavia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with one child who doesn’t go to school. She has one additional family member, a brother. She sells passion fruit juice, soda and other soft drinks at the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last four years.  She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from farming. She has requested a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy crates of soda, passion fruit, watermelon and pineapples to make juice. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a deep freezer so as to start supplying more cold drinks to different people and also to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda, passion fruit, watermelon and pineapples to make juice.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is 38 years old, and he is a resident of San Miguel, Bohol. He is married with two children, ages 6 and 13. Vicente uses his motorcycle to earn an income for his family. He transports passengers with his habal-habal (a motorcycle used to transport passengers). Vicente has been in this business for five years now. 

He is asking for a loan to buy gasoline and a spare tire so he can use his motorcycle effectively. He is determined to send his children to school so they can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and a spare tire.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor, es casado y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando solo una habitación con paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Rió Abajo de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado vacuno y de esta forma genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia. También se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas y legumbres.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar semillas mejoradas para poder ofrecer mejores hortalizas y legumbres a la venta, ya que desea tener otros ingresos por el cultivo para mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Víctor, es construir su casa para brindar más comodidad a su familia ya que sus hijos necesitan su espacio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Víctor is married and has two children who are of school age. They live in their own home that consists of only one room made of adobe walls and a dirt floor. The house is located in the District of Rió Abajo in the city of La Paz.

Víctor currently raises and sells cattle in order to generate income for covering expenses, such as food and basic services for his family. He also grows vegetables and legumes. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy improved seeds so that he can offer better vegetables and legumes to sell. Víctor wants to generate additional profits from his crops so that he can improve his income.

His dreams include building a house that will provide more comfort for his family since his children need their own space. This will also improve their quality of life. This is the first time Víctor has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy improved vegetable and legume seeds.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Buchanan. She is married and has three children between the ages of 3 and 11; they all live together and her children are attending school.

For the past six years, she has been selling used clothes. Sometimes her customers buy on credit and refuse to pay. She started this business with 5,000 Liberian dollars, which was given to her by her husband. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes for her business. She hopes to build a shop and a house.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 25 years old. She is from Cabawan District, Tagbilaran City. She is married with two young sons, ages 4 and 6.

Ana sells vegetables in the city proper in order to generate an income for her family. She also raises chickens for additional revenue. 

Ana is asking for a loan of 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy vegetables like eggplant, squash, string beans, bamboo shoots and bitter gourd. She works hard so that she can provide for her children's needs. The loan means a lot to her. 

In the future, she hopes to have a better location in the city where she can display her vegetables for better sales.

loans.use: to buy vegetables like eggplant, squash, string beans, bamboo shoots and bitter gourd.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 33 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has two children aged 13 and 17 who are in school and live at home. 

For the past 13 years, she has been operating a table where she sells used clothes. She has a lot of customers, and she makes a lot of money, which is helping her to look after her children. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes for her business. In the future, she plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en: Hamza is from Iraq. He is 47 years old, married and has five children, one of whom is employed. Hamza owns a car repair shop. He specializes in providing spare parts for cars. He established his business in 2000, and now he has one employee. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community. He is requesting $2,000 on loan to expand his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide better life conditions for his family.

loans.use: to expand his car repair shop

loans.name: Victo

texts.en:
Victo lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children who both go to school. She also takes care of her grandmother, father, and brother. 

Victo sells secondhand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 2 years and works six days a week. Victo has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of secondhand clothes. 

Victo's major business challenges are transportation, the ever-increasing prices of used clothes in Uganda, and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to rent one large shop where she can operate her business, and to start importing used clothes. She lives in a rented house where her family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en: Oretha is 46 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married, and her husband is a driver. They have ten children, ages 7 to 30 years old. Eight children live at home and two are married. For the past five years, she has been operating a little table where she sells pepper, bitter ball, onion, etc. Oretha started this business with 1,500 Liberian dollars. She enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil, bitter ball, onion and other items for her business. Oretha plans to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, bitter ball, onion and other items for her business

loans.name: Zouher

texts.en:
Zouher is from Iraq. He is a youth client, aged 30 years old. He is married and has one child. He is the only provider for the family.

Zouher owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2004 and now he has two employees. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community. He is requesting $2,400 as a youth loan to renovate his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide better life conditions for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store

loans.name: Maria Lucelly

texts.es:
Maria anteriormente tenía su tienda general en otro local que era arrendado, y como hace unos días se lo pidieron, tuvo que dejar todo y comenzar de nuevo con el negocio en un local diferente y ubicado en un sector diferente. Esto le ha traído grandes inconvenientes principalmente en la parte de las ventas, pues el ser nueva en el sector y no conocer los clientes le evitan tener mejores ventas. Sin embargo, con mucho esfuerzo ha venido sacando su negocio adelante y debido a que no cuenta con un capital suficiente, Maria busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de productos de la canasta familiar y ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.

Su sueño es poder posicionar su negocio y tener unas mejores ventas para ofrecer en su hogar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria previously had a general store at another location that was rented. A few days before her lease expired, she was asked to move everything and had to start her business over in a new location in a different neighborhood. This resulted in great difficulties in making sales since her business was new to the area and she did not know the local customers well enough to improve her sales activity. Nonetheless, she was able to move her business forward through hard work even though she does not have sufficient capital.

Maria is requesting a loan so that she can buy an inventory of household products and offer greater variety to her customers. Her dream is to position her business for better sales so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of household products for her store.

loans.name: Corazón De Jesús  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Corazón de Jesús es un banco comunal conformado por 11 socias y 1 socio que viven en diferentes lugares de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, parroquia que es una mezcla de una arquitectura antigua y moderna, está rodeada por varios paisajes que le dan un toque especial gracias a su geografía accidentada, en esta parroquia se puede observar la colorida vestimenta de su gente ya que en especial las personas mayores mantienen la vestimenta tradicional que es una pollera (vestidos), blusa y sombrero. Su gente es trabajadora como nuestras socias que laboran diariamente en diferentes actividades económicas como son la crianza de animales, la agricultura, el comercio y muchas han migrado en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos siendo su mayor orgullo conservarlas.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Rosario, conforma el banco comunal Corazón de Jesús desde hace 6 años, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 23, 19, 16 y 12 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y ayudan le económicamente, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en un colegio de la localidad. Su esposo trabaja en varias actividades como es en la albañilería y carpintería, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña María Rosario la mayor parte de su tiempo lo dedica a los quehaceres de su casa y cría animales como cerdos, pollos y cuyes que los vende en su comunidad. Trabaja solo 3 días a la semana como empleada domestica sin un horario y también cultiva sus terrenos, lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  cerdos y en el alimento para sus animales.
 
Su meta es  tener un galpón de pollos más grande y crecer en este negocio.
texts.en:
Corazon de Jesus is a community bank formed by 12 members that live in different places of the district of Valle en Cuenca, the district has an architectural style mix between the antique and the modern, it is surrounded by landscapes that make it special thanks to its rugged geography, in this town you can see the colorful clothing of its people, particularly elders have kept their traditional dress which is a “pollera” (dress), shirt and hat.  The people are hardworking like the members that work everyday in different economic activities such as raising livestock, agriculture and commerce.  Many of them have emigrated looking for better work opportunities but still maintain the culture and traditions of its people and priding themselves in keeping these traditions.
One of the members of the group is Maria Rosario who's been part of the community bank for 6 years, she is 40, married and has four children ages 23, 19, 16 and 12, her two oldest work and help her financially, her two youngest study at a local school.  Her husband works on several activities such as construction and carpentry, they don't own a house thus they rent.
Maria Rosario spends most of her time doing housework and raising livestock such as pigs, chicken and “cuyes” (guinea pigs) that she sells in the community.  She only works three days per week as a domestic employee with no set schedule and she also seeds her land and consumes what's harvested.
Her loan will be invested in buying pigs and feed for livestock.  Her goal is to have a larger amount of chickens and grow this business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and clean his land

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
This is Agatha. She is 50 years old, married, and has two children who are 24 and 27 years old. She runs a pharmacy business in Kandeh town, located in the southern area of Bo District in Sierra Leone.

She has been in this business for 7 years, and sells pharmaceutical products like oral hydration salt (ORS), malaria drugs, and blood syrup. Her business is the only income she has. Agatha's business is doing well; her pharmacy sales help her save her community from cholera disease.    

Agatha requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone in order to purchase more medical drugs such as oral hydration salt (ORS), malaria drugs and blood syrup. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to educate her children. In the future, she would like to own a big clinic. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more medical drugs for her pharmacy business

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
El señor Armando es originario de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo y tiene un bonito familia que es su esposa y dos hijos adolecentes que están estudiando la preparatoria y a quienes les quiere dar lo mejor para que sean unos triunfadores en la vida.
El señor Armando cuenta un negocio de elaboración y venta de alimentos que son (nachos, elotes preparados, fritos con queso y refrescos) esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en mas variedad de alimentos que son frutas y nieves ya que sus clientes le están solicitando este tipo de alimentos, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para invertir y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio. Con las ganancias que obtiene del negocio pagara el crédito. También tiene un empleo que es en la ciudad de alumbrado publico con este sueldo será para los gastos familiares y escolares. Su esposa y sus hijos le ayudan atender el negocio cuando se encuentra en su trabajo.
Desea mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia y tener un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Sr. Armando is originally from the city of Nuevo Laredo and has a beautiful family that consists of his wife and two teenage children. His children are attending a preparatory school, so he wants to provide them the best so that they can become successful in life.

Sr. Armando has a business of preparing and selling food such as nachos, roasted corn on the cob, fritters with cheese, and soft drinks. He is requesting a loan so that he can invest in a variety of foods, including fruits and shaved ice, that his customers are requesting. Armando does not have the necessary funds to invest and does not want to drain capital out of his business. The profit that he generates will be used to repay the loan. Armando also has a job in the city in which he is in charge of street lighting. With his salary, he is able to pay for family and school expenses. His wife and children help manage the business while he is at his job.

Armando wants to improve his family’s quality of life and continue to have a business of his own.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his food business.

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma is a 42-year-old hardworking woman. She is living in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband, two sons and daughter. All of her children are studying in school.  

She and her husband have owned a fast food business for five years, which is the only source of income for their family. Now for the further growth of their business, Najma, as a member of an eight-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase some crockery and chairs for her fast food business. 

As their family expenditures are much higher as compared to their monthly income and savings, she wants to open a new shop for her husband with the profit amount. As a result, they can increase their monthly income as well as savings. Her dreams are for the higher education of her children. And she is very much thankful to Kiva for such a great help and kindness.

loans.use: To purchase some crockery and chairs for the fast food business.

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es:
La señora Noemí solicita un préstamo para realizar la mejora de la fachado (pintarla y colocarle algunos detalles)  de su vivienda y así dará una mejor apariencia además de mantenimiento en diferentes partes de la casa.
La señora Noemí es originaria del estado de Chiapas y tiene radicando en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo a se mas de siete años, la señora Noemí y su esposo son unas personas trabajaras, ambos son empleados de una fabrica en el aria de producción, tiene una pequeña hija quien esta actualmente cursando el preescolar.
Desea mejorar el patrimonio de su familia y que su hija tenga un mejor logar don de vivir.
texts.en: Noemi requests a loan to make renovations to her house (paint it and add some details) this way it's appearance will be better and she will give maintenance to different parts of the house.  Noemi is originally from Chiapas and she's lived in the city of Nuevo Laredo for more than seven years, Noemi and her husband are hardworking people, they both work for a manufacturing company, they have a young daughter that's going to pre-school.  She wants to improve the family's patrimony and that her daughter has a better place to live in.

loans.use: To make renovations to the exterior of her house.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertence al banco comunal TODOS UNIDOS,la socia continua con su negocio de venta de auto partes de automoviles ,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia cuenta con local donde vende su mercaderia a todos sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra llantas para su negocio.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank “Todos Unidos” (everyone united) she still has her business of auto parts sales, she has been in this business for years because she does well thanks to the effort she puts in every day into her business, the member has a store where she sells her merchandise to the clients that need it, she is a responsible and hardworking person and this business helps her get her family ahead.
She requests the loan to buy tires for her business.

loans.use: to buy tires for her business.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is from Iraq. He is 45 years old, married and has six children. He is the only provider for the family. His brother, who is employed, lives with him.
 
Hasan owns a small grocery store, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He has acquired this profession by working with his father for several years. He established his business in 1992, and now he has a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to renovate his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop.

loans.name: David Manuel

texts.es: DAVID TIENE 35 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES UN HOMBRE CASADO Y TIENE 5 HIJOS. EL ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON LA INSTITUCION YA QUE GRACIAS A CREDITOS ANTERIORES HA PODIDO EMPRENDER Y HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO DE PANADERIA. ACTUALMENTE SU NEGOCIO HA CRECIDO DE TAL MANERA QUE SURTE SU PAN A DIFERENTES TIENDAS DE ABARROTES EN LA CIUDAD. GRACIAS A SU NEGOCIO HA GENERADO EMPLEOS YA QUE CUENTA CON PERSONAL PARA HACER LOS REPARTOS DEL PAN. Y TODOS LOS DIAS MANTIENE BUENOS  INGRESOS DEL NEGOCIO. GRACIAS A LA PANADERIA QUE TIENE DAVID,  HA PODIDO PROVEER LAS NECESIDADES DE SU FAMILIA Y HA BENEFICIADO A LOS NEGOCIOS QUE LES VENDE SU PAN, YA QUE LES OFRECE UN PRECIO ECONOMICO PARA QUE OBTENGAN TAMBIEN GANANCIAS DE LA VENTA. PERO A DAVID SE LE HA PRESENTADO UN PROBLEMA UNA DE LAS CAMIONETAS QUE EL TIENE DEL NEGOCIO, PARA REALIZAR LOS REPARTOS, HA SUFRIDO DAÑOS Y NECESITA REALIZAR LA COMPOSTURA DEL VEHICULO PARA MANTENER EL FLUJO DE SU NEGOCIO. ES POR ESTO QUE EL SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO CON EL CUAL QUIERE ARREGLAR SU CAMIONETA E INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO PARA MANTENERLO PRODUCTIVO.
texts.en: David is 35 years old. He is married and has five children. He is very grateful to the institution, since thanks to his previous loans, he has been able to launch his bakery business and make it grow. Now his business has grown to such an extent that he stocks his bread in various grocery stores in the city. Thanks to his business, he has generated jobs, since he has staff to make the deliveries of bread, and every day he maintains good income from the business. Thanks to his bakery, David has been able to provide his family's necessities, and he has benefited the businesses that sell his bread, since he offers them an affordable price so that they obtain good earnings from the sale. But David has a problem: one of the trucks that he has to make deliveries for his business has suffered damage, and he needs to repair the vehicle so that he can maintain the flow of his business. It is for this reason that he is applying for the loan, with which he wants to repair his truck and invest in his business to keep it productive.

loans.use: to repair the delivery truck for his business
